Trusted the Yelpers' reviews and tried this place out. Definitely worth it.  Wow this place is beautiful! This an opera house or a restaurant? Kidding. Mostly.  Haven't seen this mentioned much, but the menu does offer both vegetarian and gluten free options. Can't vouch for any of them as I like dead animals.  Skipped the Salmon and Tuna, as those are not Italian pesce. Purist in somethings. Went with the Pork Due. Asked for it blushing pink inside and they nailed it. Flavorful, moist and well, yummy.   Negative: wine list offerings seem to be put together by the distributor (not unusual). They need to be paired better with the menu offerings. Beers as well.
Very good food and service! They also have valet parking! The only negative is that it was hot outside and I had to wait a little bit for my car. Try the bottomless mimosas!

Between the great atmosphere, the friendly waitstaff, and the delicious food, there are so many good things I could say about Vivace.  As expected with an Italian restaurant, the wine selection is very nice.  They have a simple, one-page menu, but what they make, they make really well (besides, too many options can be overwhelming).  On this particular occasion I tried a few of their brick oven pizzas (I would highly recommend the Amor di Carne), and for dessert... OH MY GOSH are they generous with their gelato!  I couldn't even finish a 1-scoop serving.    One of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte!

The food wasn't all that great but the bean dip with the bread was really good, and I'm betting there are some other really good options. The ambience is what makes the 4 stars worth it. It's a beautiful restaurant with a nice view and mod layout.

Made a reservation for 5 in advance. We go there on Saturday night and they set us sitting on the big table with other group. The only thing separated us was two big vases between us. Our food wasn't the greatest. Their bread smelled like it was smoked on the grill and our salad had dirt all over it and it seemed like it wasn't washed. We call the manager and he took the salad away. I hope they can fix their issues and keep their customers happy.

I went around 1pm on a saturday for brunch.. the service was horribly slow considering the room wasnt even full of guests. I got the mussels and its an extremely small bowl for the price, but they did taste good. If the service was faster I might have had a better experience, but every time we wanted a refil or to order food we had to wave down our server every time.

I dined at vivace two days ago. I had a large party of 14 for a surprise birthday brunch for my boyfriend. One of my guests reviewed the restaurant on Facebook and described a mishap they had with seating before we arrived. I have included vivace's response to his review as well as my own person experience....    (unbelievable at how the restaurant responded to a poor review. Is this the owner's Facebook? Is this the manager's Facebook?)   "I was the one that made the reservation with vivace. I was told on the phone that unless this was a surprise celebration the entire party must be present to be seated. I gave my credit card info because I was told that for every guest that didn't show up, I would be charged $10. Okay fine. I wanted to come there. The day before the brunch I contacted vivace to update my head count and changed it to a higher amount. I reiterated on the phone that this was indeed a surprise brunch. I told the hostess my guests would be arriving around 2 and I would be arriving with the birthday boy around 2:20. She said that was fine and we would be accommodated. I did not realize the trouble that my guests went through trying to be seated until after I had arrived. This is quite embarrassing for me since I was the one inviting the guests. Our waitress Heather was so nice and very apologetic for the mishap. She gave us great service and was well compensated. All of the attending guests plus ourselves are in the service industry. As my guests left one by one, four of us remained. The endless mimosas and bloody Mary's ended at 3:45 and by this time it was 4:00. I asked my waitress if we could move to the bar downstairs so she could finish cleaning and end her shift... The manager wearing the football jersey cut her off and rudely input that they were closed and we would have to leave. The waitress apologized for his grouchiness after he walked off. I brushed it off, after all no one died. As we went downstairs and said our goodbyes near the elevators. The bartenders and managers could be seen rolling their eyes at the remaining 5 guests seated in the bar area. Wow. How obvious. Disappointed at the response on my guest's review. How embarrassing. Guess they are doing so good they can afford to lose 14 customers. "

Well...this place was pretty good...not great I'm afraid. Vivace has held a solid spot for awhile at the Metropolitan  My only encounter with the place was at a nicely executed cocktail party years ago, so I decided to take visiting family there.  Service was delayed due to poor timing of seating us to quickly after a giant table. We waited nearly 10 minutes for our server while another woman who brought us water (and claimed that was her only function on the staff that night) chatted to us kindly and politely answered our menu questions before tearing herself away to serve more water (I guess). I kind of think that any place that staffs people just to fill water glasses should be able to better handle taking care of relatively easy tables.  Although most of the food was good, I really wasn't wowed by anything. We had mussels followed by a mixture of specials and menu entrees. The mussels were strong flavored (livery) and briny. I was okay with the intense flavor, but the rest of the table didn't care for them. My wine glass appeared 10 minutes before the wine, served from a small carafe (always thought this was weird- either bring the glass of wine and repeat what I ordered, or serve it right from the bottle!). There were 4 of us, and we got exactly 4 pieces of bread-don't go overboard, guys!  Entrees, all seafood, were very good. Side items and salad were great. The kitchen did well On ambience- Several other large parties were seated and we soon found that the dining room can get so loud you can't hear your fellow diners. (Indoor voices, geez people...) so, another note would be that it's pretty loud on weekend nights. Had service been a little better, the entire experience would have been better. Since the food was good, I will probably give it another try at a later date.

Vivace was a fun place to have dinner with a family member on a recent trip to my former hometown. We arrived at 8 on a Friday night and the place was still jam-packed. As the evening wore on, the number of diners decreased and the number of lounge drinkers upstairs increased. The upstairs area (which has a full bar) would be a fantastic space to reserve for a rehearsal dinner or other special event. There is an open patio that has a fantastic view of downtown Charlotte.  The food was pretty good - nothing to write home about, but nothing to complain about either. The service was spectacular - we had a very nice waitress who helped us pick out things to eat and drink. The atmosphere is on the trendy/hip side, but nothing too obnoxious. Lots of seating available for both couples and larger groups.  Overall, I probably wouldn't return here when I visit, but if I lived in town, I might hit it up again with a group of friends. I'd definitely go for a drink on that upstairs patio with the view.

I love this place!!   Why 5 starts?  Maybe we ordered the right thing... But one thing for sure was the service!!!! We had the best waitress ever, even I forgot her name! Good service makes more enjoyable.  Then the restaurant itself , very romantic inside, perfect for dating or even for meetings. Nice designed, very open.   Lastly- the amazing food that we ordered:   Steam fresh mussel, just so freaking amazing and fresh!!! Wow wondering if I can make it at home, light sauce but so clean, and brings out the taste of the mussels!!! Great appetizer!!   House sausage pizza, fresh bake on too of a piece of wood, the sausage just so delicious, so moist as well, the pizza it self was thin and crispy, love it!!!!!!!!!!   Last and the best -- the scallop, OMG, they were not only BIG, but fresh and soft , perfectly COOKED!!!!!!! Even the sides of the scallop... Yummy, so unforgettable!!! Wish this place is right next to where I live so that I can order this every time!!!! Super fresh sea food!!!! Must try!!!!

I won't be spending my money here. Last time I tried to come here was for my friend's birthday party. She had a reservation yet they didn't tell her any policies up front about needing the whole table there prior to being seated. They forced us to wait in a crowded lobby on a hot day instead of having us sit down and start drinking. Hey if I'm a server, I know that drinks drive up the bill. Anyway, the general manager was really condescending and talked to my friend as though she were a child by giving her a lecture. His tone was nicer toward white clients whereas the majority of the people in our party were people of color. This is a racist establishment. Please notice the trend amongst the Yelpers. A lot of the negative reviews come from people of color but several white people seem to think this place is outstanding. We took our business elsewhere. I suggest you do the same!

Been here numerous times for brunch! My friends and I always uber here bc they have a weekend special that gives you unlimited mimosas, an appetizer, and an entree for $30! They also have complimentary valet parking, if you decide to drive. This place is a brunch staple!

I come to town quite often for work and this place will definitely be one of my new go-to's. The food was awesome. I love Italian food I had the mussels and the gnocchi, both delicious. The service was great too. I know serving a table of one can be kind of a let down... not quite the tip one would get from a party of 4. Usually I just sit at the bar to make it easy... but Hillary went above and beyond to make me feel comfortable. I totally forgot I was there by myself. Hopefully she'll be there on my next trip!

Friday was my second time at Vivace and both times were wonderful! I had the salmon and I have had the duck. Both meals were beyond perfect. The alcohol prices were a little too much, but the atmosphere and the food won me over.   I will be returning. OFTEN!

I made a reservation for brunch yesterday (Sunday) since my friend from Ireland was in town. It was her birthday and she mentioned that she wanted to sit outside on the patio to celebrate. I notated this when I made the reservation and the hostess said they could accommodate. When we arrived at our scheduled time, they told us that we couldn't sit outside and that they take outside requests but not reservations. This is something completely different than what I was told on the phone. So, we agreed to take a table inside. The host did not seat us until 30 minutes after our scheduled reservation. Our time at the restaurant was a little over 2 hours and all we got were entrees, a few coffees and two mimosas. Never saw a Manager or anyone apologizing for the delays. I get that Sunday brunch is always busy, but when you try and make time for your friends birthday, who's visiting out of town and the experience is this bad, it makes me not want to come back. Normally, I go to Vivace at least once a month because the food is always good. But this time really made me rethink my love for this place.

Brunch review, the unlimited mimosa deal is great. I had the carbonara which was very good, super heavy and I couldn't finish it but that was probably because I drank so many mimosas! The service was good for the most part, the waitresses definitely were a little overwhelmed with all the people waving their glassses for unlimited mimosas!

Sangria wasn't anything special. The carbonara is interesting. The pasta was homemade and al dente. Peas were crunchy and undercooked but not in a bad way. Four cheese ravioli was amazing. The scallops are very fishy but a nice light plate. Bread comes with hummus instead of butter which is a really great, healthy surprise!

I have gone for both brunch and dinner.    The brunch service was slow, we had to ask 4 different times for coffee!  Once the food did arrive, was very pleased.  It was the same quality taste and ingredients that I've come to expect from Vivace after going for dinner.  The dinner is amazing!  I've had nothing but great experiences here for dinner, even during restaurant week when its a little overwhelming.  An impressive date night or special occasion place, but I go just cause I feel like it when family is in town as well.

Sunday brunch is NOTHING without Hillary! If you don't have her then I'm sorry. This girl is everything! She makes a great conversation, is super fun, and I wish we could take her with us on our Sunday Funday!

Made a reservation here for two people and was seated 45 minutes after my reservation. They looked like they were behind or scheduled reservations too close together. The food was good, not great but good. The restaurant did have a nice atmosphere and my waiter was courteous.

While waiting for our table we decided to grab a drink at the bar. We saw not one but two ROACHES scurry across the bar top. We notified the bar lead as well as the manager. They were nice and bought our round of drinks at the bar and offered a free dessert. But that was it and it seemed like I had to haggle with the manager just to get that.( the manager on duty couldn't even make that decision he had to call the GM and ask what to do) While I was talking to the manager he proceeed to tell me he has seen them too. Why would Tell a customer that there a more critters than what they saw? I have worked  in the restaurant industry in the past for 7 years and I have NEVER seen a roach in a restaurant or seen a staff handle the situation that way. I only stayed for the bottomless mimosas Bc I was celebrating my birthday. The dessert was nasty. The server was nice

Me and my boyfriend came here for a special event on a Sunday afternoon. Quite surprised we were one couple of maybe 2 or 3 other groups in the restaurant. We chose to sit outside(for the view OF COURSE!) it was such a beautiful sight to see. Our server was Joseph, he stated he was new but he was terrific! I ordered the Pappardelle and it was delicious!  The place is a little pricy but well worth it if you want some good food. I can't wait to go back!
The atmosphere is great.   The quality of the steaks suck.   I expect better quality for this price point.

A group of friends went for a Sunday fun-day brunch! Bottomless mimosas, amazing cuisine, and great staff. The NEW dessert menu was incredible. Highly recommend for a date night, birthday, engagement party and the list continues.

The hubs and I ate at Vivace last night for dinner. Kitchen renovations are ongoing so we continue to cut a swath through the culinary scene of CLT. I had completely forgotten that I had a gift card for this place and it had been quite some time since I'd been there. I do always love the patio, though, and given that this was the first super gorgeous spring day that we've had, it was a no-brainer that we needed to make this happen. Stat.   I made a reservation for 5:30 since we both work uptown and it's easy to get to Vivace from work. I also wanted to make sure to reserve a patio table in case the entire city decided to converge on this beautiful patio just like I planned to. In my experience, this town loves nothing quite so much as a warm, sunny day and you'll be hard pressed to find a seat on a patio on those days. Apparently my patio-day ideas aren't actually that unique.   I arrived before the hubs and sat enjoying the combination of a cool glass of wine, the warm sunshine and the striking view of Charlotte's skyline. I was a little Zen-ed out by the time he showed up, I'm not going to lie. After much deliberation over the menu (more than one or two things sounded good), I ordered a caesar salad and the four cheese ravioli. Hubs ordered the caesar salad and the corzetti with wild boar. I had almost ordered this myself as I'd never heard of corzetti before. I checked the menu earlier in the day and googled it. (I like to be prepared!) It's a flat round pasta shaped like a large coin.  The salads came out and were okay. They were very lightly dressed so many of the pieces of romaine just tasted like bare romaine. Is it uncouth to wish for more dressing on one's caesar? I'm not talking a metric ton of it, but just enough that it doesn't seem like I'm just eating plain lettuce. However, the lettuce was crisp and the flavor was good. It was definitely edible and not something I was upset enough about to send it back. Also I was really hungry.  The entrees came and were both quite pleasing to look at. My ravioli had a light tomato sauce that was complementary instead of overpowering. The garlic crèma was delicious. The pasta was topped with wilted spinach, which I don't normally eat, but I included in my bites so I could say I have a vegetable with dinner. It was good with the pasta. Hubs really liked his pasta and he doesn't ever like restaurant pasta. I had to talk him into the dish so I was relieved that he enjoyed it. The wild boar ragout was the perfect complement to the corzetti and the cheese.   Both pastas were the epitome of what I look for in restaurant pasta - unique in some way, fresh and certainly nowhere near just a mess of soggy noodles drowned in a tasteless red sauce. I feel like so many places still serve pasta that way and both hubs and I always steer clear. This was different and delicious.   The service was good, but got a little harried toward the end. I got a fresh glass of wine, which I had almost finished by the time the waiter came back to see what drink hubs wanted next. But looking around, it seemed like he was covering all the patio tables and it was pretty full by this time. I think he should've had some help as he looked like he was spread pretty thin so I'm not blaming him for the snafu. He was very friendly, though, and knowledgable about the food.   In all it was a very positive experience. I got to sit in the sunshine and enjoy some good food and good wine. And I'll almost definitely be back, probably to try the brunch I keep hearing so much about. Bottomless mimosas? I'm in!

Unfortunately had a terrible experience at Vivace. I went here for my 23rd birthday which I had a reservation for however they were clearly very unprepared. I made the reservation over a week out and first off was told that if my number was off by 3 to 4 people they would charge me $150. This is absurd when I am trying to bring them business. Once we all arrived we were sat at 12:15 we had two servers (which you would think could handle 15) our drinks took about 20 minutes to come out then we sat for another 30 before they asked if we would like to order. We then waited 45 minutes for appetizers to come out and then an additional 45 minutes for our food to come out which they got one persons order wrong and the drinks were not refilled. Not only did one person speak to the manager but two and he just continued to avoid our table. They also normally do something for birthdays and did nothing for mine. At the end it took 20 minutes for checks to come out. Brunch at 12 lasted till almost 3 and there was no discount or compensation. It also ended with the female server telling me sorry I know it was your birthday, but sometimes things don't always happen they way we want them to on our birthday. I am extremely disappointed with the lack of care and service since I thought (past tense) so highly of this place and to be honest am embarrassed I invited guests to join me for a birthday here. Not only did you lose one customer but you lost an additional 15 of all the people that attended. Don't waste your time coming here

Honestly, the decor is great, the food is ok, but the staff and service are the worst!  I don't know where they hire the people that work there, but I am so over how we are treated everytime we walk in the door.    As residents of the Metropolitan, you would think they would at least remember that we lived upstairs, but after a year and a half, nothing.  They are rude, unprofessional, and completely unaware.    We have tried to give them several chances and tonight was our last.  We called in to order food for "pick up" and they told us it would take 40 min before our food would be ready.  We waited upstairs, in our home, for 40 min, walked downstairs to grab our food, and the bartender says, "wow, I thought I would be getting a free dinner tonight because I didn't think you guys were coming!".  I then told him, we were told to come in 40 min, and he backtracked by saying, "oh yea, it has been really busy tonight, it probably did take about 40 min".  No it didn't because our food was cold and had clearly been sitting there for a while.   Then he tells us, if he were us, he would have came a bit earlier to grab drinks while we waited for our food.  If we wanted to do that, we would have.  We just wanted to order a quick meal to take back up to our place...we definitely did not need him to tell us, "what we should have done".   Almost all of the residents feel the same about Vivace, so I doubt any of their business comes from us, which reflects poor management.    I don't even have the time to get into everything else they have done to piss us off in the past year.  My $$ and business will continue to go to Dressler's and Pisces where they treat the locals like family.  Take a hint Vivace.

Solid 4 Stars. Hip crowd, delicious food, great atmosphere.   We had reservations for 8:30 on a Saturday night and arrived with the place in full swing. We started with cocktails at the bar (yum) and then proceeded to our table where we dug into delicious, doughy bread, a flatbread appetizers, almonds/olives and more wine. For dinner I had the chicken with sweet potato polenta and some sort of delicious sauce. Others at the table had salads and pasta. All were decadent and amazing. We thoroughly enjoyed this meal and would be back for round 2 any time.

Are you looking for a waitress that is perfect and has amazing hair and is almost TOO chill but also extremely attentive and perfect???? Ask for Mackenzie. We LOVED her. I'm gonna scream because she made my whole day! She served Us on the patio. It was a hot day but I was never warm because of how often she made sure I had an ice cold refreshing beverage. I can't wait to come back next week.

Approved. Delicious food and really really great atmosphere. Highly recommended. Sunday brunch was packed and the wait staff was unable to keep up with everything. Hangar steak with eggs was good and the spaghetti with meatballs looked really good. The portions were a little small, but perfect for all those young skinny bankers who like to hang out at places like this. Sit outside if you can. I'd go back.

Here last night for dinner and I am IN LOVE! The decor is uber-chic with the warm tons and super cozy patio couches (upstairs and downstairs). My friend and I ate on the patio downstairs which overlooks the walking path, so perfect for a lazy Sunday experience.   Two tiny bads upfront: the Sangria; they only have red and it was pretty watered-down boring with only bar fruit. Weird. We switched to the house Merlot shortly thereafter which was fine. The service was sloooowwww which was odd since it was not very crowded. Tolerable, but slow.   The entrees, fantastic. They are about $23-$24 a piece. I had the duck, medium. It was unreal!!!! Delicious sauce and fantastic presentation. (Yes you must laugh with your date at this point recalling Christmas Story and no the duck does not come out with its head still on!!) :-D It was tender and sweet....perfection and well worth the wait. The risotto accompaniment was salty and not overdone - LOVED it!!   My friend got the crab-stuffed trout which he devoured. He totally got the Clean Plate Award and wouldn't let me try any of it! A sign that he was in love also (at least with the trout lol).   They will let you make reservations here for the patio if you have something coming up and want to be sure to be seated outside. A lot of restaurants won't guarantee patio, they will do a 'first come first served' basis for patio seating - blah..I don't like that (ahem Bricktops!!!) And when you make reservations you will get in their system...where they also log any allergies or special requests with your information - very nice!!! Love you Vivace!!! Cant wait to be back! :-D

Decent food at an affordable price. However the Asian hostess was outwardly rude to us for Easter brunch. She should not be in the food industry, or in any job that involves speaking to human beings. Other than than major setback, we had a good time.
i like their lunch better than dinner but both are good.  had lunch here again yesterday.  grilled salmon dish was excellent.  perfectly cooked and seasoned.  service was also very good

This was my first time having brunch at this location. I typically go to Tupelo café or Terrace Café. The wait was not too long however it was very busy. I didn't really prefer sitting in the bar area because it was a lot of noise and foot traffic. When my friend and I first got there and the waiter was nice, however I could tell that the staff was overwhelmed by the crowd and it took a bit to get out order and drinks however the manager came by and the service got better. If you were thinking about visiting this place for brunch I would highly recommend you come around 11 or wait till around one or 130 after the rush. I have been here for dinner and the food is very good as well as the service.   There is free valet and the parking is free as well in the garage however it is not that great to maneuver around sense it gets quite busy with all of the other retail shops. One thing I can say that stands out about this restaurant is the view of the city as well as the Greenway. It really showcases the city's beauty.  Oh and one more thing, the price is relatively good for brunch you can have bottomless mimosas and two menu items one including an appetizer and main dish for 25 bucks. For dessert it is an extra five dollars. Not too bad when comparing the other restaurants that provide brunch w/no bottomless mimosas.

I really love Vivace. They have a great atmosphere (especially when it's warm and you can sit outside with views of the city and the greenway) and excellent food. The pastas come in small and large portions that are priced fairly - the small is enough for one, the large will fill you up too much so take some home! I've tried many of the pizzas (love them all), the squid ink pasta (absolutely incredible and unique), and the veal (solid). The salads are tasty, as well. The wine and beer lists are varied enough to provide something for various palettes (which is VERY important since every Italian meal should be accompanied by a glass of something boozie)! Bonus points for complimentary valet parking at the worst parking place in all of Charlotte.   See you soon, Vivace!

I liked this place.  It was very crowded and busy the night i went but we got a table in the bar area.  The service was good and the food was well done.  The right portion sizes and everything was fresh.  I had braised pork agnolotti with carmelized pears and blue cheese and it was fantastic.  Wife had spaghetti and meatballs which she thought was ok - the sauce is a bit sweet so if you dont like that i wouldnt recommend this dish.  Friends had the scallop risotto and the smoked chicken agnolotti.  I thought all dishes were excellent.  When i return to Charlotte i would go to this place again and will definitely recommend it to friends.  Prices were not that bad either.

Worst ever .. I do LA snobby spots but come on... This is Charlotte ... Hostess - said wait was 15 minutes .. When I came back to check 25 minutes later with plenty of tables around she was too busy flirting with servers ..& when I tired of waiting she laughed at us ..  Bar - great ambience ... Except for snobby server .. Who couldn't be bothered to serve us .. Take our order .. Never smiled and took over 5 minutes in an empty bar for two cocktails and a beer .. This girl never made eye contact, was short and rude ...  We decided to close the tab and leave after waiting over 30 minutes ....  Pass For me ..:

We had reservations for 1pm, we're not seated until 2 p.m. . Did not receive a food until 3 p.m. . At best food was okay. The braised short rib hash was horrific. At best it was a beef stew with no flavor. sing to be a popular place not sure why based on the service and quality of food that I received today.

Vivace was a very stylish place to grab dinner. The service was wonderful, our waiter was sweet and helpful. We told him our budget for wine and he had very helpful suggestions and even served us a bottle typically sold by the glass, not bottle, to satisfy our wants! He gave great suggestions throughout the night and even took our valet ticket down for us so that our car was waiting when we left the restaurant.    We, two girls out for a birthday, started with the cheese and meat plate where you can choose from a list of well-appointed selections. We then had a pizza and two small plates - scallop risotto and pasta bolognese - to share. The pizza's crust was perfect and the toppings were of great quality. The scallops were cooked perfectly and the risotto was creamy. The amount of food was perfect for us to get full and also to sample multiple things.   Only downfall was the noise in the upstairs area. We were seated at a very nice table by the window, but unfortunately, in the center of the room was a ten-person group that were so loud. Like Real Housewives of Charlotte loud. They basically made it impossible to hear anything besides their conversation. Once their food came out, they quieted down. Other than the noise, the place was great!

Vivace is not your ordinary Italian restaurant. It is "go to". I like to start with their Calamari with spicy tomato aioli. Their cured meats and cheeses make for a great starter too. Try the Smoked Chicken Ravioli for the main course. It comes complete with sundried tomatoes, porcini mushrooms and madeira creama. The chocolate cheese cake is a good choice for desert.

Insanity is defined as doing the same thing over and over and expecting a different outcome, so my returning to Vivace after more than one failed meal is on me.  As I mentioned in my previous review, Vivace is a running joke amongst my friends and me, as we all agree the food is awful, but the location is convienent, their outdoor patio very inviting, and we like the bottomless mimosas on Sunday afternoons.  When I wrote my last review, I did note that their head chef, who was absent last summer, had returned to the kitchen, so when my friend suggested our brunch group give Vivace another go today, I was game.  It was a beautiful day to sit outside on Vivace's beautiful patio overlooking the downtown greenway-great for people watching.  The menu was exactly the same as last year-even if their food was good- it is not a very inviting or cohesive selection.   I had a pannini with tomato, fresh mozzerilla, and basil pesto, and for my side, the house salad.  The salad was fine- hard to mess up.  The "paninni" was not a paninni-the tomato, mozzerilla and pesto was served on a chabatti roll, and the sandwich was not grilled- which is what a paninni is- a grilled sandwich.  The cheese was semi-melted, so I guess some attempt at heating it was made, but when it arrived at the table it was cold-fail.  I ate part of half, and the side salad- what a waste of money.  And- they have discontinued the bottomless mimosas- so no need to return.  Too bad- such a great space in a great location- I wish someone who knew good food would intervene and make a go of this place

Went for restaurant week, it was okay but not the best Italian I've had in the area.  App: Duck Confit Arancini the arancini was good but didn't really have much duck flavor. The plum agrodolce accompanying it on the other hand was excellent.   Entree: Grilled mahi with melted tomatoes, potatoes and crispy brussels sprouts. The mahi, tomatoes and potatoes were fine but not spectacular. The brussels sprouts were clumsy, under-seasoned and a bit burnt.  Desert: Hazelnut panna cotta. The panna cotta was light and very enjoyable the hazelnut was imperceptible.   I would go to Fiamma or Moffett's new place Stagioni  instead, given the choice.

Meh, that's how I would describe my experience. Not good, not bad just meh. This is the kind of place that tries to be fancy and pretentious but falls short with mediocre food and service. First off, the panting situation is awful. I had to drive around the parking deck for 15 mins looking for a spot, not their fault but definitely a deterrence for some to come back. When I arrived it was pouring rain, the valet boys were standing at the front door and didn't even both to open the door me as I struggled to close my umbrella and not get drenched. That's just common curtesy in my book. Walking in I asked the hostess to direct me to the bar, she seemed annoyed by that, sorry my bad!  I grabbed a seat at the bar and was greeted by the bartender. After beginning to look at the menu for a few moments he realized he had given me the wrong one, whoops. I inquired about w gluten free menu which their website says they have. It's also written on the bottom of their regular menu that a gluten free menu is a available. However I was told by the bartender that there wasn't one and that they could just modify most thing. This was slightly confusing. I had also reviewed the menu online and had an idea what I wanted prior to arriving but once I got there the menu was completely different than the one online, that was disappointing.   I ended up ordering a pasta dishes called Bugatini with gluten free noodles, basically it was just a spicy red sauce. It was fine but certainly nothing special and not worth $18. Overall, it was just okay, nothing worthy of a second visit.

I'm a big fan of Vivace... love the upscale rendition of classic Italian cuisine. Normally I like my Italian food in the hole-in-the-wall place with the red and white checkered table covering and the home-cooked style that tastes like Grandma is cooking in the back.  So when I think about fine dining, my mind normally doesn't go to Italian (unless I'm in NYC), but Vivace does a great job.  Only reason I dinged them a star is that the Raleigh location seems to have better quality food... not sure if its a talent or food supply issue, but I think consistency is important for a 5-star and CLT has a bit of catch-up to do with Raleigh.  On a final note, it is refreshing to see an Italian restaurant stick with an all-Italian wine list!  There's a reason why Italian cuisine goes so well with Italian food - it is not a coincidence.  So to not see the "Harris Teeter" collection of wines here was great and the bottle selections are awesome... coming from a guy who is obsessed with Italian wines.

The more I go to Vivace, the more I like it. This place is fantastic! I have a lot of respect for their originality and creativity.  A small group of us went for brunch yesterday. $25 gets you an appetizer, main course and either bottomless Mimosas or Bloody Marys.   The Bloody Mary mix here has a bite - lots of pepper and horseradish - a nice dense, delicious, refreshing house blend.  I enjoyed the PEI Mussels to start, again some heat, reminiscent of GB's Fiery Mussels but I do have to say the Brussel Sprouts with bacon and potatoes (as much as we've all seen Brussel Sprouts this past year) were simply awesome.  The main course was a tough choice - plenty of great sounding choices to pick from. I opted for Eggs in Purgatory. Whoa momma! Great stuff! A chunky bed of spicy red sauce with Guanciale (cured pork jowl - tastes kind of like a cross between salami and pancetta) and Calabrian Peppers. Add two pieces of smoky grilled bread with perfectly poached eggs on top. I did not regret my choice, at all, but I did get to sample the Short Rib Hash and Quiche Fiorentino (a slab of a portion), both of which I wouldn't hesitate to order next time.  Brunch was indeed impressive. I really enjoyed sitting upstairs as well = much better views of outside and the downstairs dining room. Great service, great price. Very busy on Sundays so make a reservation!!!

L*O*V*E Vivace! Great food and great decorating design makes the experience all that much more pleasing. Very well thought out layout. I enjoy my girls nights out on the patio for a cocktail, lemoncello mojito is my personal preference. Great datenight spot as well.  The mussels are amazing.  If you have a gluten alergy, here is a place that caters just to that and meatless options, an entire menu, how considerate! The service is always on point and they have the food to back it up.
Delicious!  Calamari was easily in the top 5 I have had... Margarita pizza wasn't really traditional, but still looked and tasted great
Excellent meal.  Comfortable atmosphere. Very attentive service.  The mussels are delightful, as is the salmon.  Apricot cheesecake was a great desert.   Server Rachel did a fantastic job.  Thanks.
Our dinner was fantastic!  The new menu and chef were superb!  To top it off we had an unbelievable server --Nina made the evening outstanding!

I've been to Italy. I've tasted the perfect "al dente" achieved only by master Italian artisans, and gorged on the sweet coffee-soaked lady fingers at the bottom of my tiramisu. I've finished meals off with the carefully measured portion of limoncello and watched fresh basil bake into the home-made mozzarella of a crisp wood-fired pizza as the pomodoro sizzles gently underneath.   I find myself back in Rome when I visit Vivace; a masterpiece of fine dining and a treasure found in the heart of Charlotte. Wonderfully contemporary, yet traditional at heart, this restaurant evokes everything one would expect from a top-tier Italian restaurant.   We began the meal with the Gnocchi alla Romana with spicy sauteed shrimp, white wine and herb crema. Each flavor danced in my mouth after every bite, distinguishing itself through the freshness of ingredients and mastery of cooking technique. The primi was followed by a Chicken Cappelini (housemade pasta) tossed in a sun-dried tomato cream sauce, crispy pancetta, and topped with arugula. The richness of this dish was not overpowering and the saltiness of the pork rounded the dish off well, thereby achieving perfect balance in taste. I then finished with an enormous portion of Italian gelato and of course, an arancello (a sweet concentrated shot of sweet orange liquor 40% av.) to take me to the next level :)  Our server was prompt, kind, and knowledgeable. He had wonderful recommendations and even replaced a melting gelato of his own volition because he had thought it was overly melted.   It's restaurants like these that deserve recognition and acclaim in the wider gastronomic community. I commend the staff here and will be back again soon.  5/5

I usually give pretty great reviews, however I unfortunately was quite disappointed with my experience here. To start, we had a reservation at 8:00 and were not seated until 8:30 or later. Once we sat down, we did not have a waitress and after quite some time, we had to ask for water. My meal was not very flavorful and I was unhappy with it. They forgot to bring out my dessert, even after they severed the 3 others at my table. We were not given any silverware and it took at least twenty minutes for the wine we ordered to be brought to our table. I understand it was Restaurant Week and a busy time, however we were disappointed with the service and the overall meal quality. Such a let down!

Went here for brunch and was not disappointed. My husband had the shaved Brussels sprouts with bacon and a poached egg and even though I am not a fan of Brussels sprouts, this dish was excellent. I had mozzarella with arugula and roasted tomatoes and that also was very good. Main course of pappardelle with bolognese and goat cheese Crema and it was wow! The pappardelle was cooked to perfection and the flavor of the sauce was nice and very deep- loved it. Will definitely come back but later so we can order mimosas since they can't serve them before noon.

I was really excited to try Vivace after being in Charlotte for almost three years.  We were a little underwhelmed.  First off the prices and menu are slightly different then the one online.  I'm Italian and cook spaghetti for Sunday dinner every week so I know the cost of homemade spaghetti.  Online the price was $12 dollars which is a healthy price.  At the restaurant it was $17 dollars which I find a bit high when it was about $2 dollars worth of noodles.  There was also lot of pumpkin on the menu, which I find to be more of a fall ingredient then spring.  We did LOVE the white bean spread for the bread.  We had a vegetarian dining with us who ordered the Pumpkin Gnocchi but was given the regular meat version of it and our server never apologized just said she would fix it.  Luckily a manager came over and apologized and brought her another very quickly. We also had reservations but showed up only to wait close to 30 minutes for our table.  The had a big party of younger people who they sat in the direct center of the place creating a very loud, almost yelling atmosphere.  The food quality was really good, just other things overshadowed the actual food.  Not sure we'll be back with other great Italian options here in Charlotte.

As early as we got here, I didn't expect to see much activity. However at the early hour of 5:15 this place was going pretty strong and more people started at arrive.  Very nicely decorated and loved the open kitchen along with the light fixtures. We both didn't think the bread served was the best, as it was seasoned and served cold. However the rest of the meal was top notch.  Hubby went with the creamy tomato with goat cheese. It was excellent and natural flavor with a snippet of goat cheese that went perfectly together. We chose vivace meatball appetizer and the sauce was perfect. For an entree hubby went with scallop risotto that had a perfect sear and prosciutto that was flavorful and well balanced with snap peas.  As I dove with delight into the special - duck lasagna bolognese with house made cheese and layered veggies- it was without a doubt the best lasagne I have had in my life.  The best part is it will be added to the regular menu! Both of us too full for dessert- we left well fed and happy and the prices weren't out of line either. Having a nice deal to use helped - but without that I still think the meal was top notch, excellent service and reasonable for a High end Dining experience. Nice valet parking as well. Worth the visit!

Let me begin by saying that if you are a fan of architectural design, you have to visit this place! It's visually stunning with a warm feel but with a contemporary style which can sometimes be hard to pull off.  They do it perfectly!   Ok, so service was a little slow in the beginning during the drink order but became increasingly better.  In terms of drinks from the bar, the Sangria was lacking in my opinion.  A bit on the sour side to me.  I paired my meal with the house Merlot and it was just fine, perfect temp, etc.  The meal I ate was the crab stuffed trout on a bed of asparagus.  It was fantastic! Apparently I won the Clean Plate Award ;).  The crab stuffing was delicious and the presentation was spot on as well.  The best part about this place to me was the patio atmosphere upstairs.  They have a large moveable glass partition that opens up the second floor loft out into a patio area (w/heaters!) and the furniture is ultra comfortable.  A great spot to have a final glass of Merlot and wind down after the meal.  The only thing bringing this rating down to a 4 was the slow start and the Sangria....otherwise, total 5 star place.
The best afternoon Sangria I have ever had. Bartender was friendly and the atmosphere was laid back for a nice Saturday afternoon.

Mama mia! Modern italian in Charlotte has never looked so good and been so easy on the budget.  In the marquee corner of the Metropolitan, this 2 story restaurant/bar has some excellent views of the uptown skyline and a sleek interior that oozes style and modern class.  Luckily,they've got a menu that is equally impressive for just about any palette.  The lower level consists of a large bar area and a medium-sized dining room with a large and impressive glass wine room smack dab in the center of the action.  A large wooden spiral staircase leads up to the second floor, where you'll find another (smaller) bar and more dining space.  In the warmer months, the large glass panes looking out towards the skyline can be opened and pushed back to lead to more lounge-type space for those just in for drinks or looking for a little al fresco dining.  Nice beer selection and an even better Italian wine selection from the bar.  There are also a full list of cocktails available.  I'm not a big fan of the $10 drink, but you can't escape that here.  Beers are about $4-5 and the wines cross just about all budget spectrums.  But all that aside, the food is the real star here.  Nice appetizer selection here that includes a big selection of cheese and charcuterie, which I am a sucker for.  I can't say enough how great it is to be able to pick amongst the different offerings to find a mix that works for you- want all cheese?  Get it.  Want double prosciutto?  Fine.  All come with an amazing chestnut honey and a couple of preserves.  Other apps include flatbreads and calamari but there is a lot more to choose from here.  Fresh warm bread comes on the side along with a white bean dip that could be an appetizer in itself.  For hard-core veggies, the caprese is also a fine selection.  From there, you can move onto a a selection of house-made pasta dishes or main plate features.  There's hanger steak and a number of fish offerings that are worthy of a go.  Everything I have had here is solid good. Whether it was a pasta dish or  For bonus points, I especially appreciate the kitchen turning a shared entree into 2 separate plates.  The wife and I routinely share 1 entree due to portion size bloat.   Each time we have done this at Vivace they have always brought us two plates, with the portions equally divided.  Nice!  We've also tried dessert here and I have found the offerings to all be good, but slight in terms of offerings.  Usually 4 or so choices.  The chocolate cake is smallish in size with a miniature scoop of ice cream.  I'd just go for dessert elsewhere, if needed that badly.  So lots of young and beautiful people frequent the downstairs bar.  It's definitely a see and be seen kinda scene.  Not the kind of place you want to go slum it for the night.  Wear your good stuff and get ready for some really well executed food.  Viva Vivace!

Best brunch in Charlotte. Bottomless mimosa deal was incredible- $35 got you unlimited mimosas, a personal appetizer, and an entree. Service was always great too. Vivace was hands down my favorite spot in Charlotte during my time there. Food was always great and we liked the view on the patio of uptown. The MUSSELS, eggs in purgatory, and the chicken biscuit were a few of my favorites.

I came here for brunch and loved it. The mimosas are amazing (strong and bottomless!) and the food was fantastic as well. I had the Eggs in Purgatory, which had a fantastic sauce in addition to the brussel sprouts, which were also flavorful, albeit a little too oily. Overall, I loved Vivace and will definitely be back.
Great place! Heather was the best and the manager stopped by and checked on us. The food was wonderful, especially the brussel sprouts...yum .

Great food and fantastic service. I booked a reservation for two the previous night and the hostess was very accommodating regarding a last minute third guest during a very busy brunch time. I have been to Vivace many times for their brunch, and it never disappoints; however, the service this time was spectacular. The waiter, Tony, was extremely impressive, friendly, and knowledgeable of the menu. Couldn't have asked for a better service! He anticipated our needs before we even had to ask for anything. I will definitely ask for Tony every time I go back to Vivace!

Came here for drinks last fall. I liked the decor and vibe so I wanted to return for brunch or dinner. Went on a Sunday for Father's Day. There is a free parking lot that is shared for people and they have free valet. Despite it being a holiday it wasn't busy. Had a reservation,  but still waited 30 minutes to be seated. I mentioned in my online reservation I wanted to sit outside. Well they missed that and acted like it was a big deal to set up When only one party was outside at the time of our arrival. Waitress didn't go over menu or specials she missed brining our water to someone at our table and we had to ask 5 times to get it. It was warm outside and they served water with no ice. The food looks better then it tastes. It's very electric modern style of food. I will likely not return and overall don't recommend. My father and brother in law didn't enjoy the brunch and it was there day. The price we paid was decent. The service was lacking. There are so many great sports in Charlotte try something that will guarantee a great experience. Choose wisely.

I had brunch with a friend at Vivace today. They revamped their eggs Benedict to a vegetarian version which is delicious!!  Our server was Madeline and she did an excellent job explaining the changes to the menu. I ordered a ADD ON portion of scallops. They were $10 and they brought me two scallops. Kinda pricey for 2 scallops. It took 40 minutes to get a cappuccino at the end of our meal. Madeline was great and deducted it. Why punish the server when her restaurant failed her.  I came home and started thinking about those two expensive scallops and decided to call the manager. I phoned the restaurant and ask for manager. The host put me on hold and never returned. So at the 10 minutes of holding Mark - I hung up and phoned back. I ask for the manager again. This time I spoke with a female manager named Wyath. I'm sure I haven't spelled her name correctly. She listened to my concerns. She told me the scallops ADD ON was $6.00 for 2 scallops. I told her I was charged $9 and the menu Says they charge $10. Anyway....a mess.  So ask for specifics because even the manager doesn't know her menu. All in all.........poor response to a customer and loads of excuses.  Next-----------

Exquisite service and phenomenal food!! When I arrived, I was seated immediately by a very friendly hostess. The server was very attentive and extremely familiar with the menu. For an appetizer I ordered the tomato bisque.... INCREDIBLE!! Our entrees were cooked to perfection and so was our dessert. Might I add, the restaurant was gorgeous and the atmosphere would be perfect for any occasion. If you live in Charlotte or are just passing through, I highly recommend dining at Vivace... you will not be disappointed.

Went here on a Tuesday, first time. Place literally looked like it was completely empty, not a great sign. Wife and I looked at each other like, "we should probably go", glad we didn't. I had the scallops over risotto and being a risotto snob, I must say they did a great job with this dish. Why the place was so dead, I haven't a clue because service was spot on, and all dishes were very tasty. I have told others about our experience and I'm hoping this review ushers more consumers in because it's hard to find a restaurant that can prepare a good risotto.

Vivace lived up to the reputation of great food and service I had been hearing about. My friend and I started with two very nice Italian wines from their by the glass menu along with a bottle of chilled house water - love that. We shared their seasonal salad: roasted sweet potatoes, spicy pecans and goat cheese on fresh greens. We then ordered the smoked chicken and spinach agnolotti and the scallop risotto with roasted beets and wilted spinach.  Both entrees were really, really good. In fact, I know it won't be long before I return. It was that good.

Went here because my friend had a coupon. The food was pretty good and the atmosphere was much nicer than I anticipated. It's got 2 floors and an open layout near the heart of Uptown Charlotte. My friend and I shared two dishes: Corzetti and Pappardelle. Both were very delicious, but not worth the price had we not had a coupon. I also ordered a glass of sangria which, unfortunately, has been the most disappointing kind I've had in my life (albeit, I've been to Spain a couple times). I won't be coming back for the sangria, but I will for the food!

Solid place for Sunday brunch! We got to Vivace around 1 pm, and by that time, the patio was already filled up (1.5 hour wait). Which was completely understandable knowing how gorgeous it was outside! We didn't want to wait though, so we sat ourselves in the bar area.  For $30 per person, you get never-ending mimosas (OJ only) and/or bloody marys, 1 Appetizer, and 1 Entree. For our appetizer, we ordered Crispy Brussel Sprouts (without bacon) and Mixed greens salad (without pistachios - I'm allergic). And for my entree, I ordered Penne Vodka (without shrimp - I'm vegetarian). The Brussel Sprouts and Penne Vodka were DELICIOUS. And the fact that they kept our mimosas flowing was the absolute best. Also, their hot sauce collection and spices selection was so large! The hot sauce I chose was 'Blistering Butthole' (LOL). It was really good.  4 stars for not enough veggie options, but I would go to this brunch again in a heartbeat. 100% recommend!

This is a wonderful place in uptown charlotte. Modern feel with north Italian cusine. My wife and I went for brunch. We had the mussels and calamari to start. They were fresh and very delicious. Our entrées were the same. We will definitely be coming back.

Sunday brunch at Vivace was a great choice. I went with a party of 4 and we all did the Vivace way. I got the Caprese Salad, absolutely delicious, and the eggs in purgatory. Wow it was all delicious and we also throughly enjoyed the bottomless mimosas. The decor was really cool and open. I hope to return for more soon.

Visited Vivace for its Sunday brunch, which had come recommended to me. Nice outdoor seating great for a Sunday morning, but word to the wise, you can't take advantage of their mimosa or Bloody Mary bar until noon. Waiter was fairly inattentive and the prices did not reflect portion sizes/food quality. I would not recommend the American breakfast--sub-par bacon and eggs, though I did enjoy the parmesan polenta.

Vivace is quickly becoming a new obsession.  First off, their brunch special is incredible.  2 course plus unlimited Bloody Mary's or mimosas for $25.  They also just rolled out a new bar bites menu (the Brussels pizzetta with smoke mozzarella and caramelized onions is awesome and only $6)!  Add to this the patio with incredible view of uptown (and the greenway).  Awesome.

Yum!!! Came here for my friends 30th birthday part this past weekend and everything about the experience was great. The rooftop seating facing uptown Charlotte along with our wonderful waitress made everything awesome. They put a lot of emphasis on the birthday girl which was very much appreciated. We ordered many different items with the group and it all tasted delicious. The Cheese platter- Assortment of cheeses, jams and cured meats everything tasted fresh and was the perfect amount Caprese Salad- Delicious!  Smoked chicken ravioli - a little too smoked for my liking but all in all it was pretty decent Spaghetti - Just had spaghetti and not the meatbals but they cooked it in with red chili flakes to give it a kick and was a huge hit with everyone that tried it

One of Charlotte's best Italian restaurants, Vivace serves up great food in a fantastic setting at Midtown's Metropolitan. In the heat of the summer, the cool, modern interior beckons you to enjoy a light meal and a few drinks, while the patio's spectacular Uptown views invite you outside in cooler weather.   I've paid a few visits to Vivace after a long day at the office, and absolutely love their Pappardelle entree, as well as delicious Gnocchi and Lobster Ravioli. For an appetizer, you can't beat either their Calamari or Bruschetta. There's a full bar and some wonderful local craft beers, although none of them are served on tap.   So swing up to Midtown one evening for an outstanding Italian meal in a great setting -- Vivace won't disappoint.

I've been to Vivace three times already and I'm not going to stop.  My first experience at Vivace was a bottomless mimosas & Bloody Mary's brunch- and I was not disappointed.   What to get at Vivace: - The Vivace Way Brunch-  antipasti + piatti and  bottomless Mimosa & Bloody Mary drinks for $30 - Caprese salad. Yum! - Summer Bibb salad. Fresh and tasty. - Shrimp and Grits. It's a southern specialty, and even though it's parmesan polenta, it tasted great. - Braised Short Rib Hash. So delicious, you'll order it over and over. - For dinner, try the Ahi Tuna Crudo. It's to die for.  Why go to Vivace: - Bottomless boozy brunches. - Sophisticated. - Convenient location. At the Metropolitan. - Good service.  - Can accommodate large groups. - Patio dining. - Gluten-free and Pescatarian menus.  Four and Half Yelps.

Went for brunch.  They refused to seat us without our entire party present which is confusing since WE HAD A RESERVATION!   Not like they were using the table.  Also 4 people at hostess stand chatting-- doing nothing while we stand awkwardly in front of door in everybody's way.  Would have been nice to be waiting with a drink!  Stupid policy.

The first time I reviewed was 3/2010...the first time we came and  we Were instant fans. ..great food and service...we've come many times since and have celebrated many occasions here...unfortunately our superb experiences have come to an abrupt halt tonight and the chance of us and bringing friends back is a big fat zero.  First off, before being seated, I went to use the ladies room and slipped on the greasy floor, tweaking my knee.  I then remembered the same thing happened the last time I was there. Why haven't they figured out why the floor is greasy? Yes, I did bring it to their attention.  Our waiter, Stephan, was good..attentive and answered questions. I should have taken heed when he said, the wild boar pasta dish is out of the box and tastes different-  was that code for having no taste? You would think that a pasta dish that had wild boar ragu would taste out of the box and out of this world (which from past experiences is what I expected)...however,  it didn't have much of any flavor. At least some herbs that would bring out an explosion of flavor, but there were none.   The big bomb came with the husband's veal saltimboco. The veal came out and there were two at the table who ordered. Within a few tries at cutting the veal, hubby and guest said this is wrong and way too tough. (now I see this was mentioned in another review) Stephan came over and got the manager, Jason. Hubby said do you know what the cut of veal is in here? No, I don't.  (Wrong answer..remember Hubby grew up in the meat department and knows his cuts of meat) Jason said he would check with the chef. So, they asked what other meal would you like,  which is always a problem  when everyone else has their meal already. The replacement meals were ordered and eventually delivered, after everyone else at the table was done and their plates cleared. Jason,the manager, never came back.  In,the meantime, another manager came to ask how the meal was and we explained that the meals had been sent back. he said he was,sorry and then left. None of the managers ever came back to say what the veal cut was or to follow up and see how the rest of the meal was. As we were leaving, hubby, who was very disappointed,spoke to Jason and inquired why didn't he follow up and why he didn't offer any compensation for the extended wait. Jason's reply was that management says we don't do that, we just replace the meal (and let everyone watch each other eat their meals). Obviously, the managers have no authority to make a decision and who knows where management is.Totally unresponsive and uncaring..not good customer service. There are way too many choices in Charlotte to act as if you are the only game in town.  I've put a lot of thought in to this review. .it's my birthday night and it was my choice to go to Vivace and now I've spent an hour writing this review when I should be enjoying my night,but I just don't want anyone else to be disappointed. I should say the replacement pork chop was very good, but the lack of attention by management was the reason for the 1 star.

A few drinks here on a Friday night is what I consider the best way to kick off the weekend.  The upstairs bar is the place to be if you want it a bit more quiet, though in the winter months it can get crowded with the outdoor area void of anyone.
Very nice spot.. celebrated my best friends birthday.. they took good care of him.. the waitress helped me with his cake.. even added a ton of candles.. mimosa's were on point.. food was good..
Been to Vivace several times for their happy hour bar menu and for drinks. Beautiful restaurant. 2nd floor bar overlooking downtown Charlotte. Scallops with Risotto was awesome.

A Vivace Tale... A long, long time ago... there was a date night.... And it went a lil like this...  Well, wasn't the best experience for a restaurant, but the positives...  The waiter was very attentive.  I think I drank about a gallon of water before we got our appetizer, which was the eggplant dip (Perfect)   He also offered a GREAT wine which complimented the meal very well!  I try for a vegan diet, which can be hard if you don't call ahead, so the options here are extremely limited, I got a cheese-less pizza ( a fail-safe at any Italian establishment) and it was more of a tasteless one.  But the company was good :)  If you make a reservation, ask for a table that's separate from the wall or not along the windows.  Awkward Turtle moment when you have to move someones purse to get to your seat on the bench as they managed to cram an extra table in.  If you get stuck at one of those tables, be prepared to have little privacy and be involved in a myriad of conversations that are going on around you.  THEY GET A 4!  So, this is an update to an earlier review, I was contacted by a few of the customer service reps and they insisted we try it again!  So, they get a star for wanting to impress us!  I'm in!  LOL, so I will definitely update this soon!  Vivace is trying for a FIVE star, and I'm looking forward to it!  Once upon a giftcard...  So, thanks to an attentive management staff, we tried Vivace again... SCORE!  It was amazing!  We took the suggestion of wine and was without a doubt, right on point!   The chef prepared a 3 course vegan meal and it was A-Maze-Ing, I got lost in the flavors!  YUM!  The appetizer was a variation of Bruscetta that was made very decadently with butternut squash and flavored with vinaigrette.  Mouth waterin' good! :)  On to the main course, was a great hodge podge of arugula, shrooms, squash, broccoli and many more that I can't remember... Let's just say I got my servings in that day!  The flavor was awesome.  dessert was really done very well as well, with apples and cinnamon in a flaky pizza dough wrap topped with raspberry syrup and powdered sugar!  Welll, hheeelllooooo there!!!  Great job Vivace, we shall return,   And they lived happily ever after!  :-P

Unfortunately, North Carolina has a rule on Sundays where you cannot serve alcohol until noon so I did not get to try out the bloody mary bar :(  However, I've been here a few times for brunch and dinner.... Great service, outdoor patio is awesome when it's nice outside.   Bruschetta appetizer is a great light start.  Brunch: Quiche is MASSIVE but delicious, frittata is just ok, eggs benedict is great!  The atmosphere has an upscale and open vibe.... highly recommend trying this place.

Beautiful and elegant atmosphere , impressive wine list, a menu that changes with the season but is consistently tasty, and one of the best patios in Charlotte.  Their $10 bottomless mimosas on Sunday may just be the best deal in town.  Not too bad, Vivace, not too bad...

I have to say that Vivace has become my favorite restaurant in Charlotte. I'm not a big fan of The Metropolitan and it's "big box" tenants, but Vivace has created a great space both indoors and outside. As stylish as any major city restaurant. I have had a great meal every time I've visited for lunch or dinner. I especially like eating in the bar/lounge area. I sat upstairs once and it was incredibly noisy, but it was a packed Saturday night.  The only reason I'm not giving it "5 stars" is because of the rancid mussel in my bowl at lunch one day. They offered to replace the dish which seemed unappetizing at the time. If I owned the place, I would have offered another appetizer selection on the house, but they just took it off the bill and said no more. I have ordered the mussels since on another visit and they were exceptional. Although, if you're on a low sodium diet, find another selection. The broth is divine, but major salty.  Vivace is a good choice for any occasion...
Rude staff, queen's feast is a disaster

Before departing from Charlotte, I went with two of my friends to Vivace on a Sunday evening. The environment had been calling to me for a few months so I figured maybe last time was just a bad night and all of these 5-star reviews must be there for a reason...  But, alas.. Service was a bit slow, the wine was lovely, and I got stuck paying $20 again for incredibly mediocre vegetables. Seasoning, people, seasoning!  No bread this time around and my friends seemed to think the food was okay (one of which has been spoiled with Italian cooking from his mum) but it was nothing special.  Veggies beware: you'll pay a lot of money to be incredibly bored/underwhelmed with the food.

Had the bottomless mimosas which was great. The server was not in a very happy mood; she had a upset look but i didnt let that spoil my visit.  i had the calamari again which was even better than my first visit. I order the roasted chicken pizza which was AMAZING !!  Cant wait to go back again.

This is a trendy upscale Italian restaurant. Food is very good and the only reason I am giving it four stars it is a little pricey. The best deal is the brunch deal with the bottomless mimosa's! that's right bottomless - only place in Charlotte I have found with this deal. If you haven't been here and your a fan of brunch (which lets be real we all are) then I highly recommend this place.

Brand new to CLT and became acquainted with Vivace at the CLT Bloody Mary Festival.  The only restaurant to talk to us about their restaurant and invite us to come and check it out was Vivace.... Blythe and Trip!  Blythe is perfect person to have as an ambassadors for the brand!  We ended up going to the restaurant only because of them....how surprised were we when we showed up and Blythe was there! She personally came out and welcomed us (again) and told us about the menu selections, weekend brunch and introduced us to Chello.... WOW! The ambience of the restaurant is like stepping back in time with big band elegance and decor and personal attentive service unlike what you see today.  A hidden gem..... staff that is genuine and only wants you to have an exceptional culinary experience. Can't wait to go back and try the weekend brunch!  Huge shoutouts to our beautiful Romania server Dana and bartender Alex (also new to CLT)- we'll see you soon!   Thank you Vivace for the warm welcome - we look forward to making CLT home and becoming regulars! Cheers!
Went here for brunch, it was $30 for a set menu that you can pick and choose your appetizer and main course. A lot of options! Unlimited mimosa it was great

Fantastic upscale Italian eatery.  I recently stopped for lunch and ordered the Roasted Scallion Gnocchi.  It has jumbo lump crab, cherry tomatoes, grilled corn and lemon thyme...very light and refreshing for lunch.  Also, they have a gluten free menu with more options than most! My colleague ordered the braised short rib pasta off this menu and said it was fantastic!

Great atmosphere. Just ate lunch. & was not crowded at all. Would have to try at night on a weekend to get a better feel.  Ate here a 2nd time in the evening with high expectations, none of which were met. Everyone in our party of 3 would have preferred a nice tasty burger like the one Samuel Jackson ate on Pulp Fiction.  I needed some Sprite to wash it down.

My first Zeta Alum outing was at Vivace for brunch. The brunch deal is pretty good here. So for about $30, you can get bottomless mimosas, an appetizer, and entree. It's definitely worth doing if you're wanting to drink. I didn't end up getting the deal because I wasn't sure what the vibe was but next time I will! I got the short rib hash... literally the best has I have ever had! The meat was so tender. Highly suggest getting it (can be included in the $30 deal). This is definitely a great brunch place to go with the girls if you want to get a little bit dressed up. Happy brunching!

Love this place! You can come on a romantic date night or even just a casual night. One of my favorite places to sit is out on their patio because you get a great view of the Charlotte skyline. Light and modern American cuisine that never fails to please!

Kinda a fail ... Very limited menu ... We went looking for a place open on a Sunday that would have some good sauce ... They only really had spaghetti and meatballs,  bolognese and ravioli. So if your looking for lasagna, forget it they don't even make it.  Nice atmosphere, beautiful decor, great waiter

Horrible service--the general manager was condescending, rude, racist.   I made a reservation for 10 for my birthday for brunch. I spoke to a hostess THREE TIMES prior to the day of the brunch and even the day of to ensure everything was set to go. No one ever mentioned their "policy" of not seating people until all of the party was there.   When I arrived there were 4 of us and we were told we couldn't be seated until "all or the majority of the party was there". We said ok and waited for more of my party to get there.   After 6 of us were there I asked if we could be go ahead and be seated. They said no, they could sit us at a 6 top table if we wanted to be seated now, but they would only seat us at a 10 top (the number for the reservation) if all 10 of us were there.   My friend asked why they wouldn't have a table for 10 ready since we made a reservation and the manager let us know their policy. My friend said ok that doesn't make sense but it's your policy. The manager said loudly as she walked away "I'm sorry you feel that way!"  At this point 8 people in my party had arrived. The manager went upstairs to get the table ready and when he came back down to get us, my 9th person had arrived. I let him know and he rolled his eyes, sighed and said "now I have to see if I can get a table for 9 together". I let him know I didn't understand why this seemed to be a hassle for him since I had a RESERVATION so they should have already had a table RESERVED for 10. He explained that they were running a business and he was trying to accommodate me when in reality he "could just cancel my reservation" since we were late. He then began to lecture me about how if I showed up to a doctor appt late I would have my appt cancelled. At that point my friends and I decided to leave and take our business elsewhere.   Also interesting was how another party of white females was allowed to go upstairs to their table and sit down to "set up" even though their entire party had not arrived. The manager NEVER apologized to me after having 2 convos with me, yet apologized to my white friend who walked in last and never talked to him. Hmm....
Great brick oven true Italian Pizza and Amazing Pasta!!

Finally made it to Vivace with the dinner group and had a wonderful experience.  First off, I love the atmosphere. The decor features huge orange-ish chandeliers, wooden panels on the wall above the kitchen, wine cabinets on the opposite wall from the front windows and comfortable seating.  They have a nice patio overlooking the Little Sugar Creek Greenway for when it gets warmer and a seating area for just enjoying a glass of wine and conversation.  Instead of having a large menu, Vivace's features a few selections that they do very well.  Our table started out with the meat and cheese plate for an appetizer which I have to say my favorite was the hot sopressata and the gorgonzola.   I also had the Lentil Zuppa which was a savory brothy soup which is a nice change from cream based soups found everywhere else.  The homemade sausage in the soup had a wonderful flavor and texture.  For my main course. I had the Smoked Chicken & Spinach Agnolotti which has some incredible flavors in a very flavorful cream sauce.  My tastebuds were going nuts with this that one of my table mates said I was purring.  This is definitely one of the best entrees I have had in ages.  The dessert menu looked great but I just didn't have the room.  Service from our server, Caroline, was exceptional.   Even though there's a bottle of water left on the table, she was constantly refilling your glasses, clearing off the table, refilling wine and beer glasses.    And they play great music here.  We heard a lot of Thievery Corporation during our meal.

Really GREAT food in a wonderful modern atmosphere.  Trendy, Big City feel, plenty of room, dining areas divided into rooms to create a more cozy feel.  Calamari was best we've had - mixed with fried red peppers and fried squash/zuchini.  Veal was super thin with just the right  tasting of their ravioli covered in a beefy sauce.  Lobster Ravioli was filled generously with a vodka sauce.  Orangecello drink was super flavorful.  Ending of Strawberry Tiramisu was just the right amount of sweet.

Went there with my wife on a Friday night.  We had made the reservations in advance, since we had heard that it gets busy over Fridays.  We reached around 8 and the place was filling up, so we were lucky to select the table of our liking.  Ambience and the decor is quite good, gets little noisy.  We opted to seat indoors, since it was humid outside. They took some time to take our order, but were patient enough to answer our queries about vegetarian options.  What we had: Bruschetta - Average Four cheese ravioli - Good Fried Gnocchi on side - Above average Wine - Don't remember the name, but they have quite a lot nice collection here  Overall it was a nice experience and would visit again...

Couldn't remember great server's name but went back this eve.  Sweetie got us great table on lower terrace.  Server tonight was Crystal...new, but she's a keeper!  So nice & was honest about what she's tried & her thoughts.  Server on earlier review was Amber...great!  Jaime is house manager & he was friendly & interested in how we enjoyed our food & evening.  Gnocchi is delicious Salmon dish very good but bits of pancetta were like pickles-super vinegar-y...weird but it didn't ruin meal.

This is a great spot, service was awesome and great atmosphere.  Brush up on your italian, the menu can be a bit of a mystery...Lol.  I looked the goat cheese and the expresso, and the dessert oh lala

So... we made our reservation significantly in advance via Open Table making note of an Anniversary and a gluten allergy for one guest. We heard positive feedback from friends about this restaurant. Therefore, expectations were elevated. It was a true disappointment just walking in the door. It is enjoyable to know a restaurant is in demand in a busy city on a Saturday night. There were no guests at the bar and it was only about 15-20% full.  We were 20 minutes early thinking we would enjoy a cocktail before dinner yet we were seated right away. A friend suggested a specific martini. We asked about it based on the liquor. Our server wasn't familiar and needed to retrieve a cocktail menu as we weren't given one. The beverages weren't served with the garnishes described by friends who dined at the eatery just the evening before. And the glasses were only a third full.  The wine list, while huge, has zero selections outside of Italian. I get it that we were at an Italian restaurant, but it seemed limiting. The server didn't seem knowledgeable about pouring the bottle we ordered. She fumbled and never offered the cork. Further, she wanted to rush us through our decisions.  On to our appetizer. We always enjoy mussels. This was prepared in a tomato broth. Sadly, the Roma tomatoes were huge making it very awkward to try them. Overall, while they weren't tough, yet there was very little flavor at all. When we asked the manager about the dish including the tomatoes, he got incredibly snotty.  We were offered a half glass of Prosecco and an offering from there upcoming fall menu to celebrate our Anniversary. While it looked great, I didn't eat it. Gluten allergy. Clearly stated when the reservation was made. I waited while a sub of Burata and tomatoes was brought. A tough exterior to the cheese and a serious lack of seasoning.  Entree. Husband's veal was enjoyable. My steak. Again lacking in seasoning. Spinach purée cold. Romesco had zero punch to it. Asked for another dish. Scallops with risotto. Scallops weren't cleaned properly- gritty. Risotto far too crunchy to be al dente.  When we asked to speak to the manager he was nothing short of a prima donna escalating his voice when we raised our concerns. This was truly our worst experience! Thankfully we have found other much better options in CLT. We will NOT return. I actually felt held hostage to some of the worst service with this treatment.

Such a neat restaurant! Love the decor & huge orange light fixtures. Food was excellent- spicy bean purée on garlic bread, seasonal salad with grapefruit & oranges, and the risotto di mare- one of the best I've ever had. The food service was a bit slow, we were in the restaurant for almost an hour and a half; but worth the wait.

Big fan. Very big fan of Vivace. The ambiance, the decor, the fantastic drinks and food, and the knowledgeable staff all make this one of our favorite places to dine in Charlotte.   Be sure to make reservations and then arrive a bit early and have a drink at the upstairs bar. There are doors that open up to a view of Uptown Charlotte when the weather permits, and it's just a gorgeous place to catch up with some friends over great drinks and appetizers. Speaking of food, here are a few of my favorites:  Appetizers: the calamari with spicy tomato aioli is very good, as is the meat & cheese plate. They also bring bread and white bean spread to the table as a starter, which is very good and can be quite filling.  Salad: the seasonal salad is always great as it has homemade dressing, and the caprese salad is a solid choice as the balsamic is very good.  Dinner: the margherita flatbread, smoked chicken and spinach stuffed agnolotti, and the chili-capellini and lump crab are all great choices.
