The agnolotti is my favorite go-to dish at this restaurant.  Desserts: honestly, the desserts are a bit small and not for sharing (think tea cake size), but are very delicious. You should definitely try the gelato if you have any room left after dinner.  There is valet parking if you can't find a spot in the deck, and a very large patio on the ground floor for sitting outside if you so choose. If you haven't yet, you should try out Vivace; you won't be disappointed!

whoever listed this in Meyers Park is wrong....the neighborhood is considered Midtown.  the food is hit or miss....sometimes i've had amazing items, other times i've been disappointed.  obviously you cannot deny the view from upstairs.  and i do love their bottomless mimosas for brunch.  service is usually good.

We celebrated our first year anniversary of marriage at Vivace, and while the experience was intimate and upscale, the food was just average (albeit creative) and the service wasn't quite where it needed to be for the vibe and presentation. It wasn't necessarily a let down, but we didn't leave blown away.  In terms of ambience and style, I loved what Vivace offers. The restaurant isn't exactly Uptown but the view, particularly from the balcony, is stellar and peaceful. The inside is very modern and a bit romantic. We were given a very sexy corner in the loft upstairs that I adored.  Our waiter was decent. He knew the menu well and had great suggestions, but he was very relaxed and kind of slow. He seemed full of personality but lacked the polish that I like to see on a nice evening out.  The nitty gritty is the food, which counts the most. The chef sent us complimentary seared scallops with a compote of mixed unknown vegetation which was a very nice way to start our meal. Neither of us like scallops anywhere but felt compelled to eat them due to the gesture. For the first time ever, we both enjoyed the scallops. They had an awesome texture and weren't salty/fishy at all.   For the main course, I knew exactly what I wanted. The cider braised pork shank with cherries, cabbage, and some kind of mustard dumpling (but not a dumpling... Like small crispier bread bits). The pork was delicious, though a better shank comes to mind. I was disappointed in both cabbage (thick and red) and the dumpling things (soggy, rather flavorless) and had plenty of room after for dessert which never happens. Hubs ordered spaghetti and meatballs (way to step out of the box!) that he thought tasted like every other spaghetti and meatballs. He thought changing the meat mixture would enhance the dish greatly. I took a bit of the noodles and sauce only and thought it was really good and flavorful!   For dessert we both shared two unbelievably gargantuan scoops of gelato - one being a vanilla with chocolate swirls and the other a seasonal pumpkin. The vanilla/chocolate gelato was milky and unremarkable, the pumpkin was extraordinary and the best part of our entire meal. The latter is possibly the best gelato I've ever had.  Being an Italian restaurant, we were also pleased with the wine menu and enjoyed a recommendation that was special yet didn't go over our budget. This is a nice spot if you're looking for a romantic evening out but are trying to avoid a $50 per head cost.

My husband and I visited this spot recently, but while the view we enjoyed from our seat was great, the food wasn't.  I have definitely had better Italian, even in Charlotte.  I had a mushroom risotto, which was terribly bland.  And my husband's dish was so meh, he doesn't even remember what he ate.  We won't be visiting here again.

We went during restaurant week- some people did the $30 tasting menu - I opted out. We had everything from appetizers and wine all the way down to dessert and I was SUPER impressed.  Being a native New Yorker I have set the bar high for Italian food and I have to say this delivered!   I started off with amazing bread and a delicious Cabernet - next I moved on to one of THE BEST Caesar salads Ive ever had (fresh cheese, delicious croutons, creamy homemade dressing) ...next I had my entree where I enjoyed the homemade pasta (it was a smoked chicken and spinach stuffed agnolotti  = fabulous!!!!) ...then we split a few desserts - while not as memorable great none-the-less.  I will definitely go back- give it a shot if you are sick of the same 3 Italian restaurants in Charlotte !

I'm really torn on how to write this review.....   I was so excited to find a place that has bottomless drinks and takes reservations.    We had a party of five and got there at 11:45 on Sunday.  We waited forever for our order to be taken.  Three of us got the vivace way and the other two just ordered drinks and food.  The drinks were slowly brought out, but my first course was brought out quickly.  It was a salad that was actually really good.    We all waited a really long time for drink refills, which was disappointing.  For the main course three of us ordered salmon.  One of them was cooked perfect and the other two were really burnt.  We had to send them back.  As a side note I haven't had to send food back at a restaurant in forever.    When they were brought back out one was under cooked and one had hair on it.  We kept the under cooked one and sent the one back with the hair in it.   We then ordered a dessert to share.  The dessert was really good, but when the waitress brought it out she winked at us and said it was for a birthday.   We asked for our checks multiple times with one more drink refill.  The poor waitress tried to get the manager and told us she wasn't sure what was going on with the kitchen and why we were having to wait so long.  The manager finally came over and told us he was taking care of the check.  The waitress then brought us our checks and we were all charged for our drinks and for the dessert.  It was very strange.  We all just paid the bill and left.    I don't think it was the waitress' fault for any of it, just seems like the kitchen can't handle the bottomless drinks with a full restaurant.     The environment is really nice and the views of the city are amazing.  I agree with the other Yelp reviews about the slow service.

Was tasked with finding a place to take out of town friends for brunch. The catch was not having an hour to wait to be seated. Made a reservation through OpenTable about an hour before and were seated as soon as we arrived. Would have liked to enjoy their lovely patio..but...July. Interior decor was beautiful, loved the chandeliers.   My manfriend and I both opted to do brunch "The Vivace way" -- $25 for an appetizer, entree and unlimited mimosas and bloody marys. A really good deal if you are going to have at least one drink. I was disappointed that they didn't have the bloody mary/mimosa bar out for Saturday brunch, but will have to come back on a Sunday to try.   Everyone was happy with their meal. I ordered the calamari for an appetizer and thought it was a little bland. My Benedict was good, but they overdid it on the hollandaise a little. The bread and ham they used were so delicious I would have liked to be able to taste them more! Rosemary potatoes were awesome. The shrimp and grits were really good as well. We also enjoyed the drinks. Bloody Marys simple yet delicious and I liked that they had pineapple juice for mimosas.   I took a dinner menu to look at and definitely want to come back for some pasta!

Like some others, we jumped on the Living Social deal to Vivace.  I really have no idea why they threw that bone out there, as I am fairly sure they have no need of it, but since they did, we used it.  Definitely glad they did (and that we did).  The service at Vivace is second to none, as is the scenery, inside and out, though the layout of the interior is a bit odd - perhaps it is those massive red chandeliers from the bizarro Ikea world.  Or maybe it is all just a bit disjointed rather than having a nice flow to the place.  There is what I would call a dining room to the right (with a bar), a bar to the left (with bar tables, but no dining room), and another dining area upstairs (also with a bar).  The bar downstairs also has a patio and the dining area upstairs has a balcony.  Unfortunately, each time I have been there, it has been at least overcast outside, if not downright scary, making those outdoor spaces less than ideal.  Still, the heaters are nice - it just makes the view less than spectacular.  Not their fault, but it does impact the usability.  Which leaves the food.  We found it to be hit and miss.  Some items are average, like the meat and cheese platters.  Good, but not great.  Others, like the fish, have a nice crispy skin in one area, but the same skin is mush elsewhere.  Then you get a nice piece of meat, say the short rib, that is tasty, but man is it rich!  Had to stop after just a few bites.  Luckily it belonged to someone else - if it was mine, I would have been disappointed that I had to stop so quickly.
Trendy inside décor with a very nice outdoor patio.  The food is just OK, but the ambience makes it the perfect place to take a date.

First off the location has a fantastic view of the Charlotte skyline; recommend a table on the second floor!  Food was very good, flavorful, and unique. They have a extensive wine list and specialty drinks that were amazing. The menu had a decent variety and portion size was perfect...highly recommend the Chicken al Mattone!  Valet parking & reservations recommended; the staff is very friendly! Probably not a good place for young kids, but they can accommodate large groups.

Our favorite Italian restaurant in the area. Everything is house made. Even the deserts. I took my wife today for her birthday with 80+ yr old mother.  Our server Bryan took the utmost care to ensure we had a great experience, who is lead by a manager who really cares.

The place was super trendy, and I felt like I was dining in the heart of Manhattan. Vivace was a great spot to admire Charlotte's city lights, enjoy some tasty Italian treats, and create new memories. Read more about my experience here: http://www.ginapacelli.com/2015/04/17/north-carolina-vivace/

Beautiful restaurant with outside seating and complimentary valet.  However the food was not up to par. We started with the bread it came with a dip that was tasteless n the waitress did not tell us what it was. The bruschetta was way to sweet. For dinner the risotto with scallops. The scallops were extremely salty. Even the tiramisu was not the norm, it had a gelatin like layer, layered throughout the cake.

This place was good, but not amazing. The service was very good, especially considering how busy the restaurant was. The food was just OK. It's pretty good, but not good enough that I would come back. That being said, this may have been partially due to the fact that we came during Queen's Feast, so the kitchen may have been overwhelmed. I'd come back and give them a second chance next time I'm in the area, because their menu was inventive and decor was excellent. I also thought, considering the crowd, our server was extremely effective.

Let me preface this review by saying, we walked in 15 mins before close on a Sunday night. The servers were still very friendly and patient. We ordered the meat/cheese combo for an app that came w/ three great dipping sauces... Honey, apricot, and apple. We didn't like all of the meats and cheeses but it was fun to try different varieties of them.   As for the entres... very delicious!!  The only negative thing was the lighting was very dim for having such big light fixtures.   Highly recommend it, specifically for the value, ambience, quality, and new trendy location.

Definitely still a big fan of Vivace. It definitely is (still) one of the best looking restaurants in town with a sweet patio and *stunning* upstairs lounge area. If you're seeking a private party space you must check out that second floor.   Service is spot on and are happy to not only describe the dishes, but they go above and beyond detailing the wines on special, where they come from, what the grapes are like, etc. The menu changes up on occasion and I had the pleasure of trying their new-ish chili capellini with crab. While it sounds like an odd combo, it was tasty and light filled with a sizeable portion of pasta, fresh crab, tomatoes, spinach and a dose of fresh crab meat. And it was spicy! It a good way, of course.   For dessert a few girlfriends and I sampled the warm chocolate cake with nutella gelato (WINNER), the apple crostada (with cinammon gelato - delightful) and the mint chocolate chip gelato. Vivace is still one of my faves in the QC. Grazie!

I was so excited to come for brunch. All of my friends have raved about. The food was decent but honestly the mushroom frittata was under seasoned. And by under seasoned I mean no seasoning. And the server was not attentive at all. He had two tables at the time and I waited over 20 min for a refill. I had opted for the unlimited mimosa option. I had received two mimosas within our entire time being there. By the end I was seriously just looking for my server to close out. Not worth paying the extra price for unlimited if your drink sits empty for half an hour. I get being busy but to be blatantly ignored was not ok. I took leftovers home and my family commented how poorly seasoned my food was. The salads though were great

Started the night off with a drink from the bar and the bartender was great and the cocktail was delicious. We got to our table and the server wasn't very interested in us, didn't even mention his name. Service overall was very slow on his part, refilling glasses of water, clearing glasses and dishes from the table etc. I may be a little more harsh because of working in the industry in the past but it's the truth and in a nicer restaurant like us I had expected more. When our food came they placed it in front of us and zipped off. The next time he came back to check on us my meal was finished and it was mediocre. I ordered monkfish with the risotto and another friend at the table ordered the same dish. The presentation was very much half done and my dish was a lot more watery looking then her's. The taste was a 3 out of 5 of the risotto and the fish. The vegetable on top was undercooked and too hard to cut. No manager come by at all during the meal to check on the group. The company I kept was great, the interior of the restaurant is still beautiful but I think overall the caliber of this restaurant has gone down tremendously from when they first opened roughly 6-7 years ago, the first time I was visited. With all the other choices out there these days, I don't believe I will be returning anytime soon.

Was excited to try Vivace having read reviews. I had high hopes for this self proclaimed hip Italian.  However, we were greatly disappointed with our entire experience.  From the start our waiter was extremely rude and checked out.  The tuna crudo with melon was tough and tasteless. The veal was also tough, over seasoned, and basically inedible.  The grouper was swimming in burnt brown butter and the fried gnocchi resembled fried pasta paste and tasted flavorless. This was time ever that we asked for the bill and left the restaurant during the entree course! It was that bad! Vivace is hyped as a trendy, hip Italian but is truly lacking in everything including style.

Vivace is conveniently located off the greenway, within walking distance from Carolina Medical Center. My brother and I walked here to celebrate my birthday after visiting my mom in the ICU last month. There's lots of seating both indoor and outdoor and would be a nice place to eat outside and people watch when it's warm outside like nowadays.  It's wasn't a busy Wednesday night. Our server was good, giving us enough time to review the menu. We split the Brussel Sprouts Antipasti. The portions are generous even for the appetizers. I loved the mix of sweet and savory with the apples, pecans, and smoked pancetta. Maybe a little over dressed with the butter but otherwise my favorite dish of the night. I had the Pappardelle as my entree and it was good, standard fare. Pasta could be a bit more al dente. Again, good portion size so I had enough to take home for a second meal. Overall it was an a-okay meal with a nice and quiet ambiance.

small plates but i felt it was worth the bill. Wife and i split spagetti and meatballs soup and asparagus. Bill with drinks was 60 bucks. Good surroundings and view staff could of been better. Good meal all in all

I appreciate the focus on italian wines and beers, a great detail.  The pizza good.  I have been twice and it was significantly better the first time.  I had steak both times, the second time it has much less wood-grilled flavor.  Grilled peaches were not good, muscles were decent.  I am not  crazy about the white bean dip they give you with the bread either and requested olive oil, which was a major improvement.  Usually the special is good.  Nice views, good ambiance.  Great for a group or a date (or pizza at the bar).

I have to give Vivace 5 stars for a number of reasons:   1. Service is outstanding. Go here and you will be treated the way I wish EVERY restaurant in the world treated their customers-friendly and respectful staff, no snobbery either.   2. The food. Here are just a few of my favorites:   Mussels: If you are a mussel fan, get these. A large portion of mussels (none of this 10 dinky mussels in a dinky cereal bowl type of thing). The broth is excellent. Want extra bread for dipping (recommended)...no problem!   Cured Meat and Cheese board: You can select a variety of cheeses and meats for a yummy appetizer. The staff has never steered me wrong when asking for a recommendation.   Warm Bittersweet Chocolate Cake: I have come to Vivace solely for this dessert (after eating dinner elsewhere!). Be difficult like me, and ask for plain vanilla gelato, if they have it, in purist fashion.   I have tried a variety of their entrees, the salmon and duck particularly stand out. Oh- and their brunch options are delish, and will cure even the sickliest of hangovers, with class of course. Portions are very nicely sized. The atmosphere is lively, modern, but still relaxed and un-stuffy. Please go to Vivace, it will not be your last visit.
Awesome awesome brunch on Sundays. The food was incredible and so was our server Nina, she made the experience a 10/10! Great calamari!

Went here for restaurant week with a big group and we had exceptional service - our waitress was attentive and funny.  The three course meal was big portions - I couldn't finish each course, but all were delicious.  I had the Brussel sprouts, fish and tiramisu.  The dessert was probably my favorite part!

I recently came here with my boss for happy hour and have to admit, I was impressed!! The outdoor seating by the greenway makes for a pleasant seating area because you aren't sitting on the road, like many other restaurants in Charlotte. We ordered cocktails which were all great, I had a Mojito and mule. My boss ordered a drink that came in a tiny martini glass and was pink.  He wasn't too happy.  We also ordered the calamari and flatbread both which were great.  Customer service was good too - our server couldn't have been nicer and more accommodating. Also, plus with the complimentary valet.  Will be returning to explore the menu more.

Wow!!! Classy place with attention to detail. They have an expeditor who makes sure food is served in a timely manner and that the food looks and tastes wonderful. I had Bruschetta made with beautiful Heirloom Tomatos, Lump Crab Cappelini, garluc spinach and Lavender Panna Cotta. Every dish was great! The Cappelini had an amazing amount of crab meat, and the sauce was infused with tasty crab flavor. The pasta is house made and served perfectly Al Dente. Best italian food I've enjoyed in quite some time. Service was quick, friendly, and above the board professional. Great place for a romantic date.

Vivace is an awesome place to sit outside for both couples and groups! Super tasty discounted apps during the week. Service lately has been not so hot, but the rosé makes up for it. Great view of uptown and located right off the greenway. Recommended!

I've been getting quite generous with my ratings as of late, but I feel like it's so well-deserved!  Maybe I'm dining out and getting lucky with some spots, or maybe I'm just in a general jovial mood.  Whatever it may be, let the good times roll.  First of all, the place has a modern feel, but still very classy.  It's a good balance of a nice solid sit-down first-date restaurant (maybe?) but also a great place to hang out in the bar and patio.    So given all the upside of the patio and bar (and probably the good-looking people that would frequent such a spot)... I came here for Saturday lunch when there wasn't any diners.  What?  I came after a round of golf, in full golf garb, to get a solid meal in--I wasn't disappointed.  I ordered the spaghetti.  Simple and classic to really gauge the cooking...if I wasn't completely blasted already for a round of golfing + day-drinking.  It hit the spot and I appreciated the portion size.  It wasn't too much where there's lots of leftover, but at the same time, it wasn't too little that left me wanting more.  Props to portion control.  Service complemented the food well.  One dude in our group doesn't eat meat, and ordered the sea scallops with risotto.  It came with prosciutto and the staff took it back promptly without a tinge of unhappiness.  It's a classy thing to do and was surprised at how well it was handled.  They don't get five stars for this, it's a reason that they have five stars--if that makes sense at all.  I'll gladly be a patron of this restaurant, and hopefully I can make it out here on one of the more popping nights... looks like a good scene...  dmo out.

We visited for brunch and the service was great, but the food took 90 minutes to come to the table! My friends and I went and all got the $30 brunch special. The mimosas were constantly being topped off, which is great, but I think its to distract from the fact that the bread took 30 minutes to come, appetizers took 45 minutes to come out and the main dishes took even longer. Everyone at my table ordered the quiche with side salads, so it really doesn't make any sense for it to take so long to cut a slice of egg pie and put greens on a plate.  The food was okay but we'll never come back. We could've eaten 3 meals in the time it took us to get one.

Let me start by expressing the build-up that was my expectation for this restaurant. I have been wanting to try Vivace since it opened its doors to the Charlotte public.   I heard great review after great review so the bar had been set pretty high. I elected to go during restaurant week so I can dip my toes into a few different dishes and not feel like my wallet was getting ambushed.   Overall thoughts? Awesomeness and I will absolutely be back. I had the risotto balls to start and they were heaven in my mouth. Perfectly cooked with a sauce to die for. Loved. I would have had them as my main meal as well if I could.   Then I opted for the steak. Eh. Just alright but definitely not bad. The sauce that came with the dish was finger-licking good but the steak was just a little under-cooked for my liking. My friend got the chicken capellini pasta and I thank my lucky stars she let me try some because holy goodness it was awesome. Unreal actually.  Dessert was perhaps my biggest area for concern because I went for tiramisu. My most favorite dessert of all time and I will judge a restaurant on its food quality based on the tiramisu that they serve. Vivace did not disappoint and actually got an extra star for serving it with a caramel sauce and Espresso gelato. Absolute deliciousness.   My overall thoughts? Get yourself to Vivace. STAT.

Friday night (7/22/2016) was my 3rd time to Vivace. My 1st 2 experiences were great with no complaints, however, this time extremely disappointed me. I want to write off the sub-par food to it being Restaurant Week and it being busy because of the event. I took my husband there because I raved about the food at brunch, and it seems like everything crumbled for him. Our appetizers were delicious (I had the caprese salad and he had the cheese tray). However, our main entrees left a lot to be desired. I had the lobster ravioli which came out barely on the verge of warm, and the raviolis were hard around the edges. My husband ordered the steak with potatoes medium-rare, and it came out to the table cold to the touch, and RED rare. The dish also came with a huge roasted bone for the marrow, which looked like a nasty chewed up dog bone (so un-appetizing). When my husband sent the steak back to be cooked closer to medium-rare, our waitress dropped the bone on the floor, which splattered everywhere, and no-one came to clean it up the entire rest of our visit (other guests and servers were walking through it). When the dish came back, the steak was barely warm and still red. At this point, I had finished my dish, and my husband decided to eat some of his. After a few bites, it just wasn't appetizing to him, and the consistency of the meat was almost like pot roast. Thankfully, our desserts were much better (he had the black and white tiramisu and I had the watermelon sorbet). Overall, the best part of the night was the view we had from upstairs. Brunch is highly recommended from here, but this time around, I wouldn't recommend this place for Restaurant Week dinner.

Vivace has now surpassed Lumiere as our favorite restaurant in Charlotte.  We recently visited them twice for New Year's Eve and January's Restaurant Week, having not been here in almost a year.  I'm not sure why we waited so long to return, but we definitely won't wait that long to return.    Everything was on point.  The New Year's menu was delicious, but I'll focus on Restaurant Week, as we could choose anything on the menu.  We started with the carne and formaggio tray and smoked trout burrata.  My husband really loved his meat and cheese tray, including the pickled veggies.  My burrata was fresh, and the trout was delicious.  The portions were perfect.  For our entrees, my husband had the Zuppa de Pesce, and I had the scallops.  The Zuppa had a rich broth, and was full of seafood.  My scallops were the best preparation of scallops I've EVER had.  They were served with kale and a celery root/truffle purée that was divine.  I'm salivating just thinking of that puree.  There was enough to have some with every scallop bite, and it really added to the flavor of this dish.    For our desserts, my husband had their gelato, and I had the mint chocolate tiramisu.  The gelato was thicker and richer than I've had before, and really good.  We took my tiramisu home, and enjoyed it over the next couple of days.    Service at Vivace is nothing less than stellar.  And we prefer sitting upstairs, where the seating is more intimate, and the views are spectacular.    All in all, you can't go wrong with Vivace!

Server was really rude, didn't not bring bread to the table, never asked for reorders of drinks, never checked to see if the food was ok and had an attitude when I confronted him regarding the lack of service and quality.  Food was ok, fish was salty and the broccolini was really bitter and inedible.  The pizza was just bad with nothing but cheese and no flavor.    Pick any other place but this for any occasion.

The brunch is awesome. I've only been there once, and that was for late brunch so can't say how their dinner or bar side is. First, brunch doesn't end at 1pm or even 2pm. Vivace - whether you pronounce it vi-va-chi or vi-va-che - has your favorite Sunday brunch until 3pm. That's pretty cool. Especially because I went there around 2pm feeling a ton like having toast and eggs.  We didn't exactly get off on the right foot. They made me and my wife wait for somewhere around 15 minutes. It was 2pm on a Sunday afternoon, and you could see that it's not jam packed in there - or outside. But I did see that they were working on it so I didn't say anything (although my voice became a bit of a megaphone towards the end when I said, "are you guys ready?!").  In any case, I had the Benedicto Vivace. On point. Right on, guys! Great job with the fries and the eggs! Really, I didn't expect it to be sooo good but it was. The egg was just right with perfect color and texture. The fries were not greasy or burned but had the right degree of crispness (?). Oh, and the lemonade that I ordered to go with it killed it. Man, did I enjoy my third meal of that day. (Yes, I had breakfast and lunch before that. But...)  So there you go. And tonight, fellow Yelpers and I shall check out how it's like there at night! So stay tuned!

It was our first visit to Vivace. We sat outside on the wonderful patio. Great views of the Greenway and Uptown skyline. Our meal was very good! Delicious calamari (huge portion, enough to take home) and a good caprese salad. We both had pasta for our mains that were also good.  Overall the atmosphere was more remarkable than the meal, but we will go again for sure.

This place is really great!!  Hubs took me here this past weekend for my birthday.  We had a nice little booth on the second level with a great view of Uptown! Our server was excellent and VERY helpful when it came to selecting wines and food pairings.     The food was really good.  I had the Trout stuffed with Shrimp and it came out hot and fresh.  It was devine!  Flavor was amazing and presentation was excellent.  My hubs enjoyed his smoked chicken with spinach dish as well.  For appetizers we had calamari (which was a nice generous portion size) and bruschetta.  I didn't care for the bruschetta.  It was a little different than what I'm used to.  It wasn't bad but it wasn't great either.  Just ....different.  :) Def give it a go...you might like it!  We absolutely loved the atmosphere,  and the decor of the place.  We even took pictures of the walls and decor to use as inspiration for our own house!  Loved it!  I would defiantly say this is a place we would return too again.  Great for a mid size group or a romantic evening with your main squeeze.  :-)

My friend had her rehearsal brunch in the upstairs area and it was so nice! There was a pre set menu but the drink menu was huge! I got a Caesar salad (the Parmesan was amazing) and the ravioli was really good. They make their dough in house and the sauce was the perfect combination of sweet and spicy! Honestly the best ravioli I've ever had! I would definitely go back!
Great place for Sunday Brunch! Nice sociable atmosphere!

Service is always a little off here. From neglectful to just weird. The bartender was telling me a story about how he liked to wrestle dogs to the ground. Which ruined my appetite because I didn't feel like talking for hours to him anyway. Sangria is good, meat board is good, meatballs are good. Otherwise overpriced.

Ate hear for restaurant week. It was pretty good. The service was good, but there was a party downstairs and they were kind of loud. Outside of that my dinner was good. We didn't get seated right away even though we were there on time (they were turning over from brunch). Outside of that I'd recommend this restaurant. I think I'd be a good place to have drinks or at least brunch on a Sunday morning.

This restaurant was an instant favorite of mine. From the moment you walk in the door you know that this is not your ordinary run of the mill Italian restaurant. The decor is modern and crisp and the staff greet you right away - a mere hint to the type of food experience that awaits.   Unlike everywhere else I have have had Italian food in Charlotte, you can order even the heaviest of items from the menu and you will find that they have somehow been transformed into lighter crisper/fresher dishes. The flavors may become more delicate and modern as a result of Vivace' take on Italian cuisine but you should know that nothing is lost in translation.   I have been to Vivace multiple times and I have always had a great experience all around. The service is snappy and the food is good.

Very nice atmosphere. This place is great for a date night, brunch with friends, or private dinning. I went for brunch. They have a $30 two course meal with bottomless mimosa. I had calamari and the lobster bisque. Both were amazing!! Everyone's food was delicious. The mimosas were great too! Service was great! I definitely will be back.

This was my first time at Vivace and everyone in my party agreed that this place is overrated. While I rated it 3 stars, "meh, I've experienced better" is more accurate. Two just seems too low, as there was nothing wrong here. I give the service a 10/10 and the food a 6/10. I had my niece, who is 18 months, with me and they went above and beyond to accommodate everything that I asked for. Kudos to the valet and staff.  My waitress said that the scallops with risotto would come with 4 scallops. There were three, which actually would have influenced what I ordered had she been accurate. Additionally, I thought that the dish was a little bitter and lacking in texture and character. Scallops have to be surrounded by something with pizzazz and the risotto simply missed the mark. One of my friends had a pork chop with salad on top. I'm sure that the name is far more fancy and Italian, but that's what it was. It was huge and she enjoyed it, but again said it was nothing to write home about. I'll give this place another try. I've heard the happy hour menu is tasty.

I came here on a Wednesday night and wow...it was glorious! You step into the building and you no longer feel like you're in Charlotte! The decor is fantastic and the service was spot on. I ordered the soup of the day which was a delicious cauliflower and broccoli purée with cream and prosciutto. Omg! I could have eaten just that, however, I also had the parpadelle bolognese. I ordered the appetizer portion and it was still pretty massive. I only managed to eat half of it, but the goat cheese on top made it divine! My friends enjoyed their pizza and steak as well. Oh, and the calamari was pretty good as well. It could have used some lemon for acidity but it was yummy nonetheless. I will absolutely return!

Had been here before restaurant week and liked it. Came here on restaurant week...and they rocked it!!! Service was great....they were very busy and crazy...but still provided knowledgable, friendly service. Burrata was amazing...hope they add this to the regular menu. Our cocktails were amazing...our waiter, wish I could remember his name, made us a specialty cocktail with our two favorite cocktails mixed! Great time!

Modern Italian and DELISH!  Great spot to meet up with friends for drinks and dinner.  I had my birthday dinner there and the service was great.  The four cheese ravioli is outstanding, you can add chicken or shrimp to it.  The Beef Arugula & Parmesan App was a greater starter along with the bread.

Pros: Valet Great brunch spot Quick seating Decent menu   Con: Although our waitress was pleasant enough, the hostess was rude and stuffy    I think the time I went was just an off day. We went for brunch on a Sunday. The woman told us there was only seating outside, even though there was only one table being used inside. Their brunch deal is great! All you can drink mimosas or bloody Mary's with an app and an entree for $30. The coffee was horrible! It tasted like water. I sent it back and she didn't charge me, which was nice. The menu isn't large, but has enough options. Our food was really good. I might try it again. I've heard great things, so I'm wondering if we went on an off day.
Brunch is amazing! Your choose of appetizer and entree with unlimited Mimosa and Bloody Mary Bar! $25

So we decided to try this restaurant out during restaurant week with two other couples. When you first arrived they have free valet parking which is always nice (especially in the heat of the summer). When you walk into the restaurant it has a large floor plan with two different levels and two different outside patios. We were seated upstairs which was a nice smaller area with its own private bar.  Overall I was very impressed with the layout in the design of the restaurant.   The food, all the food that I happen to order was pretty good overall. I wasn't blown away by anything though. I'm not going to hold that against the restaurant because all the other people I was with thoroughly enjoyed their meal. And it may have just been my failure to order what my taste buds were craving.  The waitstaff was very organized and professional, when there was an issue they took care of it right away and apologized.   In the end, my overall experience at the restaurant is worthy of five stars. they did a great job and the food was very good I would recommend it and return.
Excellent brunch! The Bloody Mary bar is a brilliant idea and the mimosas are to die for. I had the meatballs, bruschetta and the burger.. All delicious.
2 stars is me being nice. This place has gone to shit. The food was pre-prepared, and cold. The service was horrendous. I used to come here quite often, and I will NEVER be back.

Great setting for a lunch or dinner date. Food was GREAT and tasted as if made from scratch. The customer service was to match as our server Everett was vert helpful. I'm def taking my lady again (getting a beer this time).

Where do I start with the horrible and unorganized service that was given to us on a Sunday brunch. The people honestly felt like they either were lost in space or just flat out didn't like their job.   I didn't even want to get food because I knew it was going to take over an hour. I order a drink and they told they didn't have it and I was just like you should know what you carry and don't carry anymore or update your menus.   Granted that's not as big of a deal as the fact of the TERRIBLE customer service here! Maybe dinner is better but forget about their brunch and go somewhere else like Dandelion as they have the BEST GRITS. Will not be rushing to brunch or a dinner at Vivace any time soon if I'm going to be treated as a second class citizen.

We had the pleasure this week of visiting Vivace during Restaurant Week.  Restaurant Week dining can be hit or miss in some places, as the huge volume of business can show the cracks in one's service planning, but the staff at Vivace are on the ball!  3 courses for $30?  They up the ante to 4 courses--5 if you count the amuse bouche.  Before we even ordered, we were brought little plates of corvina ceviche, which were fresh and bright.  We were seated in the upper dining area near the bar, which is a little less formal than the main floor, and affords a very nice view of Uptown.  I think this place could be a little loud, but being up there helped immensely with making conversation without shouting possible.   Our waitress happily explained the items on the menu we weren't able to translate ourselves (I know now ceci means chickpea in Italian!) and then we were off to the races.  My husband had the watermelon and balsamic appetizer, the flavors of which he said were "unexpected" but very good in combination.  I snacked on the aforementioned fried chickpeas which had a very nice spice on them--maybe harissa?  Something Mediterranean, but not your traditional Italian garlic and basil.  Spicy and flavorful, and fun as finger food!  Then came the first course, which at our table meant bruschetta with fresh peaches and basil (mmmmm, toasty!), and sweet corn agnolotti.  Oh, the agnolotti!  Little pillows of thin pasta bursting with a filling of creamy mascarpone and darkly sweet carmelized onions, coated in a sauce of fresh sweet corn and butter.  I will now forever dream of these when I think of good pasta.  They might make it onto my Death Row Meal list.  Outstanding!    Next up, entrees.  I had the fish, a corvina in aqua pazza with fresh tomatoes and cucumbers.  This is a very meaty fish, and the fresh veggies made for a light and satisfying meal.  However, I cast several longing glances at my husband's hanger steak and potato croquette.  Okay, I admit it, I am a bite-stealer.  Protect your food!  That potato thingy was amazing!  Crispy and crunchy on the outside, meltingly fluffy potato mash on the inside.  This kitchen staff knows what it is doing with a steak, too!    Lastly dessert.  Ah, dessert.  For me, tiramisu, for Mr. L, the lemon panna cotta.  Both very satisfying, both creamy, but light years apart in their vision of dessert.  The tiramisu was sweet, creamy and rich, the panna cotta was thick and light, with a little astringency from the blueberries.  In all, a perfect ending that suited both our dessert palates.    Will we go back during a normal dining week?  Oh yes!  There is a charcuterie plate we saw go by that I must try, and I am sure their grilled pizzas are a wonder of bread and cheese engineering, and, well, everything on their menu looks like it is well thought out and carefully constructed.  What a pleasure!

Went on Father's Day for Brunch and had The Vivace Way - delicious!! The Roasted Strawberry Parfait & Panettone French Toast were spectacular. Very light, yet filling. Can't wait to go back to try more options.

**Gem Alert**  I have found another rare delight in Charlotte. This restaurant is right outside of Uptown but worth the travel. It begins with a perfect ambiance that is extremely complimentary to an all around delightful dining experience. You are able to bring your own bottle of wine and that truly helps keep your check in check. They prepare all the pasta on site and it is deliciously fresh. We started off with the mussels appetizer and we couldn't get enough. So many mussels!! And the sauce is the kind that you need to soak up every last drop with the bread. Which we did! For my entrée, I order the Smoked Chicken and Spinach Stuffed Angolini.. MMMMMmmmmmmmmm (see picture).. It was superb. My wife ordered some shrimp and pasta dish that I didn't try because my face was glued to my plate (See 2nd pic). I wish I went a little slower and enjoyed it more, but that is what the second trip is for. Right? I obviously recommend this restaurant and suggest you put it high on your list of places to try in the area.  Helpful Facts:  * Free valet parking * Great bar are if you have to wait * Huge wine selection if you don't want to byob/byow * Excellent service and knowledgeable staff  Enjoy!  -Ian M.

Blythe Bayrd has to be, hands down, the most amazing server and bartender in Charlotte. The food, service and professionalism is amazing. I always look forward to having an amazing brunch at Vivace. Josh Grogan was very nice and came by to check in and ensure my party was having a great experience. Brunch is only done well in one spot in Charlotte, Vivace

Blythe and her team BY FAR are the most courteous and attentive staff I've been around. The brunch is the best value! Blythe helped me plan the most amazing work party/brunch and my co workers and I will definitely be back!
Been sat here since 8:30 - 10:15 now - still not even an appetiser in sight! Absolutely terrible service! A birthday dinner should not start off this way! STAY CLEAR- just awful

Pizza was OK wasn't a real fan of the goat cheese in the pizza.  The spaghetti with meatballs was great... pasta cooked al-dente just like fine Italian pasta should be cooked, and their gelattos flavors were great... really liked the cinnamon one.  Cheese and meat platter yum!!
Excellent food. Well priced. Make sure to sit in scott's section. EXCELLENT SERVICE! :)

Finally, another brunch option!   My boyfriend and I have honestly been underwhelmed with the brunch options in Charlotte. I had company in town the other weekend and decided to give Vivace a try. I am glad we did.   They have a lovely patio with a view of the city, which is perfect for brunch. We made reservations, so we were seated right away.   I loved that they had the Vivace Way- an appetizer, entree, and unlimited mimosas or bloody marys for $25! It is a great deal, and they allow you to switch back and forth between the bloody mary and the mimosa. I figured they would be small portions due to the price, but we all left stuffed! We all shared a little bit of everything, and we were all impressed with our dishes.   Highlights for me were the meatballs, the pork belly hash, and the quiche. Everything was yummy though and I felt as though I got my money's worth.   I will say this seems to be a trend for Vivace reviews, but I would've given this place 5 stars if we had had better service. I hope they start to take the reviews seriously and improve upon this. Our service was mediocre, and if it was better this would've enhanced the experience.

Consistently good food (recommend caprese salad and pizzas -- fig & prosciutto and margherita). I love meeting friends up at Vivace to enjoy the outdoor seating & couches on a warm casual evening. I also love the upstairs balcony --the views are spectacular!  Vivace has a nice happy hour but doesn't disappoint for dinner either. Great space, vibe and overall experience.
This my second time to this lovely establishment. The staff was very friendly and attentive and great perfect view of the city.

This place had a nice vibe to it.  It was located in a nice area, and the atmosphere was nice.  The environment was nice and modern, but I'm not that much of a fan of it.  I really just liked the orange lamps.    I was not a big fan of the menu.  I really did not know what I was ordering.    I just did not get much details from the menu.  I did enjoy my  chili-capellini & lump crab though.  I thought it was delicious with  a little kick of spice.

Best gnocchi and mushrooms I have EVER had.    In my opinion:  Service was average.   Pizza, which I do not eat often, was not my favorite.   Will be back for ambiance and food. Just need to know what to order.

I recently attended an event in their private upstairs dining space. This space is FANTASTIC for private events, small receptions, or even (hint, hint), holiday functions! It has a private and fully-stocked bar, a large space that can be appointed to seat a fair number of guests (or, set up for over 100 if you do hors d'oeuvres (lighter food far, antipasto, appetizers...). Additionally, there is a beautiful (really nice!) private terrace/balcony up there. I was able to meet the event manager David, and he was delightful. I'll try to remember to upload a picture of his card. He was very bright-eyed-and-bushy-tailed, and super friendly.   The way they do events is quite simple, and reasonable... you don't have to pay a deposit, instead, you simply sign a contract committing to rent the space, and have a minimum to spend on food/bev. So if you want to have a sit down dinner with x guests, he'll just work with you and say we just need you to spend at least $x on food and beverage. I'll add, this is exactly how we've done it at Ruth's Chris and other CLT establishments for my holiday parties. You also have the option of setting a specific menu, going a la cart, or, picking what apps/etc you want set out or passed. They'll work with you.   Also, they have complimentary valet (don't forget to tip!). This is a MUST for any restaurant in Charlotte. While there is a free and close parking deck, I prefer the convenience of pulling up and letting someone else worry about finding a spot. :) Plus, (random factoid), they're next to Trader Joes - so you can stock up on that oh-so-delicious Cookie Butter. Dang it, now I want Cookie Butter. I digress...  The particular event I went to only had hors d'oeuvres, which simply means I didn't get a chance to try their entrees or pastas (which I would have liked to try). Oh well, it gives me a goal next time I'm there. So what did I try? I first had what the waiter said was blue cheese stuffed fig. Errr... I like fig, and I love blue (or any kind of funky-) cheese, but I was not a fan of this. But, don't let that discourage you because many of my fellow guests did seem to enjoy it. For me, the ratio of bold cheese (really bold!) to fig was off. Dare I say, too much cheese? GASP! I said it... oh well. (Though, really, you can't ever have too much cheese... or bacon.) Darn, I'm off track again.   Ok... where was I? Oh yes, hors d'oeuvres. They had oodles of olives (that's fun to say... try saying it 10 times fast!). The olives were fresh, flavorful and diverse. Yum! They also had blue cheese stuffed olives, which I enjoyed! Of course, you have to appreciate both olives and blue cheese - if you do, this would be a treat. We had a huge antipasto platter to pull from. It had an olive spread (almost like a tapenade meets hummus), which was good on their pita-breads. They had an assortment of quality meats (spicy and yummy salami and pepperoni), and even better quality cheeses on the platter. Now, the show stopper for the night was the cheesy fried risotto balls. Let me be clear, if you dine here (event of not), you MUST ORDER THESE! Delicious and perfectly balanced. They went very quickly, and despite the lovely staff hustling to refill them, they would run out many times before the platter made it to the table. That good!  Lastly, I cannot forget to comment on the drinks. They had VERY STIFF drinks (read: strong). This I actually think is an upsell... I had trouble drinking my mixed drink, but generally, when I pay the market rate for a mixed drink, I want value in the booze-to-mix ratio. This place has it down! Of course, they have a great assortment of wine and beer as well.  So, while I can't comment on the traditional dining service, or the heavier entrees, I do recommend Vivace based on my experiences here. Great location, easy to get to, valet parking, and quality ingredients in a modern-but-sleek restaurant.

Was at Vivace about a year ago, and was such a wonderful experience - I gave it five stars.  Been a while, and celebrating a birthday, we decided to go to Vivace for brunch.  We called to make a reservation, and indicated we would like to sit outside -- this seems to cause a lot of confusion.  We were told they don't reserve the tables outside -  we indicate we are on our way, and should be there in about fifteen minutes.  I've said it before, the Host/Hostess is the first impression for any restaurant.  The host we had today, should not be in that role.  We arrive and ask for a table for two, and would like to be outside.  They ask if we have a reservation, and I go to explain we called and were told they don't reserve the outside tables.  I was now under the impression they don't have any tables as the host stated we could sit at the couch area with coffee tables.  I state we'd just rather wait for a table-now there seems to be a table and immediately seats us.  The host sits us by the door, and I hate sitting by the door, and asked if we could sit at a different table, as there were plenty open tables.  He responds, NO, those tables are reserved, and had a smirk!  This made my blood boil. I just wanted to leave, but I go to ask for a manager.  After going in to ask for a manager others at the restaurant intercept and correct the table situation  -- now it's no problem to sit at another table?  This pretty much set the pace and mood for the rest of the brunch.  It was embarrassing, and my brunch was not as enjoyable as it could have been, I was actually a wreck - we were really looking forward to a repeat of the first visit.  Today, I ordered the Chicken and Biscuits, and they were very good - the dish wasn't very hot, but warm - the flavors were good.  My companion had the Eggs Benedict, and her food wasn't hot, even warm to say the least.  At this point, I asked not say anything more, as I've already made enough fuss over the table. Others at the restaurant apologized for our experience and stated the host was new.  He shouldn't be a host without proper training - dealing with the customer, again first impression.  This could have been handled so much better.  I was very adamant I didn't want him taking care of our table, and guess who brings our food out.    Quite honestly, not sure if I want to go back - certainly not for brunch, as we have many other places that we enjoy - better overall experience.  Even more disappointing, is no one from the restaurant ever reached out to discuss--they must not care

Sooo Vicace brunch used to my go to spot but now I'm not so sure. The experience started off unfortunate after we had to repeat our order 3 times and went 26 minutes without drinks. In fact our food came before we got our drinks. I got the frittata and it was more of a block of cheese looking egg jello that was not ok (see pic). The waitress acted like she didn't care and said oh yea...we changed it. Thanks would have been helpful to know the frittata was no longer a frittata. We also ordered the thyme ricotta squash bruschetta and instead received plain toast with olive oil and tomatoes. Confused I asked the server if I could see the menu.  Did I order the wrong thing? I was told that they also changed it last minute and probably should have told me. I am not picky so while I was annoyed I ate it and moved on. Buuuttt then our server was gone.  25min went by and I never saw her. I asked another server if I could get a drink refill and was told I had to ask my server. Needless to say I got it another 10min later with my check.
Amazing decor and has a great wine selection too ! We started with the fried calamari and a pitcher of Sangria. I had the steak panini and my girl tried the chicken pesto panini we both love it :)

I ate at Vivace's a few months ago, and loved their duck lasagna. This year, I thought it'd be the perfect place to celebrate my birthday. I was so excited, and had planned a dinner with my friends months ago. Sadly, it was a terrible experience, and I will never go back.   The food was HORRENDOUS. I was SO disappointed by the choices. I had my eyes set on veal with ravioli, only to be told by the waiter that it had prosciutto (ham) in it, and I'm not allowed any pork. I also couldn't have it made without any. Seriously???   I decided to just order ravioli and calamari (I love calamari!). Well, the calamari was tiny, cold, and very peppery. It took about 45-50 mins for the food the be brought out, which would have been okay, had the wait been worth it. The ravioli tasted, I kid you not, just like the frozen stuff I get at the grocery store. It was smothered in thick lumps of mozzarella cheese that got stuck in my throat.    By this point I was just so upset, because I was really looking forward to indulge on my birthday. The waiter told me she would bring some pasta instead. It took another thirty minutes for the pasta to come, and in the mean time my friends had already finished their meals. By this point I had no desire to eat my dinner while my party was finished with theirs and ready to leave.   My appetite was gone, and I just wanted to leave. My birthday dinner, which I thought would be so special, was ruined. Just a little bit of effort on Vivace's part would have made the world of difference.   The menu was scarce, and the only two options are either something with pork, or completely vegetarian. I was very disappointed, and my birthday dinner was ruined.   I will NEVER go back to this place. I'd much rather go somewhere where they put a little more love and care into what they serve to their customers.

I came here before for dinner and they are very gluten free friendly! They had really great pasta and it actually tasted like it was freshly made (GF) which I was very impressed with and still want to know if it was made fresh...  I recently came back for brunch and they accommodated a huge group of us and the service was still attentive.

I was disappointed by my visit this evening. We were sat 30 min after our initial reservation and had to ask for water, 15 minutes after being seated. The food was average and after waiting over 15 minutes for a second glass of wine, I was charged for a more expensive wine than I ordered. I was really looking forward to great service based on previous reviews but left less than satisfied.

I gave Vivace another shot this past weekend and I am glad I did....  I'm glad I came with a group this time because I was able to sample quite a few different items and we started with a couple of their appetizers which were very good.  We tried the bruchetta, grilled artichoke and the calamari....the bruchetta won the competition and may even be one of the best I've had in town.  The grilled artichoke was a little dry and flavorless but the calamari was on point.  Between the 8 of us we tried quite a few pasta dishes from the very basic spaghetti and meatballs to the homemade cavatelli in a sweet potato cream sauce to their Bolognese that had a goat cheese cream sauce...everything was wonderful!!  I like that they offer full or half portions because the pasta was definitely heavy so the smaller portion was just enough!!  The service was good for the most part...the hostess crew seemed a little dazed and confused but unfortunately that isn't totally abnormal.  They called to confirm my reservation and I told them it went from 10 guests to 8, when I arrived they had me down for a party of 10 and the table was set for 10, yet when other members of the party started to show up they were told there is no party listed under my name...whatever!!  The waitress was lovely and the service the rest of the night was great so that's all that matters.  The food is not what I would classify as Italian...I would say it is Italian-fusion but there is not much about this restaurant that is traditional...I think grandma and grandpa macaluso would be insulted that we call this Italian!  However, they do serve pasta and fish so that has to count for something!    The wine list is pretty diverse and affordable and the menu has something for everyone so that is a huge plus as well.  As so many have mentioned, the atmosphere is beautiful, sleek, trendy and modern.  The view of the city from the balcony is lovely...overall a great experience.

Loved it.  Here's why:  -first timer, the chef sampled us a mini plate...shrimp and grits BRAVO -tasty non-alch lemon pineapple refresher -ambiance -service (he knew the menu, was nice and HOT) -nice and cool inside to save this cali girl from the humidity -loved the grilled 'chokes with chipotle sauce -OMG the desserts....we tasted 3---all delish!  fave was the italian take on tres leches!   ---only thing i wasnt too crazy about was my entree.  boar ravioli.  seemed too al dente  (tough) to me  I will certainly return when I can.

My first time at Vivace for my husbands birthday dinner. We were in the private dining area which was really nice and cozy. The appetizers, cocktails, dinners and deserts were fantastic!  The staff made it a memorable night, we will be back for sure.

The restaurant has a unique, modern, open style to it, that I love. The drinks were great and the food was too! From the white bean dip, pizza, to the meatballs and pasta, a nice treat in the Metropolitan shopping center.

I had a great time. I went for my first time yesterday for brunch. For 30 dollars, you get an appetizer, an entree, and bottomless mimosas or blood Mary's. it was great. I got the Brussels sprouts (made with bacon and potatoes) and the crispy chicken sandwich. Great. The chicken DID need a little more seasoning but overall, it was really good. Will definitely be back.

Vivace is a good Italian restaurant with a modern twist we enjoy going to this place. The food is good as well as the service. Really nice Decor with great views of the city skyline. one of our favorite places

I used to love this restaurant and was excited to reserve a table for New Year's eve. We ordered sparkling water, as suggested by the server but she returned shortly to tell us that they ran out of the sparkling water. The restaurant planned a special menu for the celebration for $65pp, but the server informed us right away that they ran out of fish. My boyfriend wanted to have fish but we said ok, let's do lamb. The server takes the order and then returns to us and tells us that they ran out of lamb as well.... We were not going to let that spoil our celebration so we ordered whatever was available and waited for the countdown... When I mentioned the countdown to our server, she smirked at us and said "there is no countdown and the restaurant is closing." They closed the restaurant closed at 11:50 pm - 10 minutes before New Year's - turned on all lights, turned off music, started sweeping floors. A couple sitting next to us was also not happy about how the restaurant spoiled the celebration and they turned on music on their phone and we all continued meeting the New Year's and making the best out of the situation. They also told me that they came to this restaurant every year for New Year's celebration and it was never like this, there was always a countdown, music, champagne.... Not sure what happened to the management but this time is was obviously not executed very well. If f this was any night of the year, I would not be so upset but this was our first New Year's together and there will never be another chance to have a first New Year's ever again.

This is a great place to go enjoy a drink or have a nice meal. The food here is top notch and service is great. They also have a great wine selection. The restaurant has very cool modern decor & is definitely the ideal spot for a date!

The BEST brunch in Charlotte.  You can't beat the price or the food.  Plus unlimited Bloody Marys or Mimosas.  Food is excellent and I have enjoyed our servers each time.  Do yourself a favor and try the Brussel sprouts...amazing, as well as the gnocchis.  Yum!!

My first experience at Vivace was divine.  The atmosphere was fantastic and the food was every better.  Our selections included the the Steamed P.E.I mussels (good), a Caesar Salad (nice), Scallop Risotto (I am a fan!), and mint chocolate Gelato O Sorbetto for dessert (fabulous).  We brought in our own bottle of wine (superb) and paid a $10 corking fee.  My strongest advice is to make reservations otherwise, you will have to wait.  We had an early dinner @ 6:15 so that we could attend the Kirk Whalum concert (nice).  The only drawback was that we were seated near the register used by the wait staff so they tended to congregate in that area.  Check out my photos.

Brunch alert!  Get your mid morning appetite ready.  Recently went to Vivace for the first time after a Yelp private event. Was excited to sit down and enjoy a full on meal after seeing the ambiance and decor of the inside of the place. I'll be honest, the parking situation at the Metropolitan had kept me away for so long. However, they have valet so can't even look at that as a negative.   Decor, food taste and selection as well as service for the price point. This was truly a 5-star brunch!  We arrived a few minutes early and took a seat near the spacious bar. Were promptly seated once the others arrived. Our waiter briefly explained the brunch options and got us started on drinks. Honestly he was one of the best servers I've had recently and I wish I had gotten his name to pass along the praise.   The food selection for brunch was one of the largest and most interesting I've seen anywhere in Charlotte. I had the polenta for a starter (pictured) and eggs Benedict for my main. All delicious. I'll mention the Benedict comes on thick bread which I expected to be difficult to cut - no way, it was soft and easy to eat!  Did they think of everything??   Two thumbs up and five star for sure. I'll be back!

This is a really cool looking restaurant, and it seems that someone spent a lot of time picking out bar stools, lighting fixtures, counter tops and flooring. I would rather have seen the same attention to detail in the food and the service, but that's just me.   I sat in the downstairs bar and found the waitress to be scarce when my glass was empty and stopping by a couple of times just after she brought the drink, I will say that she seemed new and a little nervous so maybe it's not the norm.   As for the food, I found the carpaccio with the red cabbage to be unique but disappointing. The calamari itself was nothing special although the sauce it was served with was interesting (in a good way).   I am assuming based on the decor this place will have a decent crowd so if I find myself back there I will sit AT the bar and grab a bite elsewhere.

I like this place a lot, the location is convenient, just a few blocks off of uptown, 2 blocks away from the freeway. But it is in upscale little condo land "metropolitan" along with Aveda spa and Pisces! Ashley is my server and she is great! She went above and beyond to make me feel comfortable! She also is very understanding with my many needs. The mussels are really awesome and the garlic bread that came along with it was well prep. I enjoyed the mojito drink which was I requested to be more sugary. Their cheese cake is great too. I will definitely come often when I need a good place to relax. My recommendation is come between 2:30 and 4:30 pm during a week day to enjoy the ambiance in a quiet and undisturbed manner!

As a fan of brunch, I'm always looking for a good solution for my raging Sunday hunger pangs. After church, we decided to swing by Vivace.   On the positive side, they had $2.50 mimosas. Also noteworthy is the bruschetta appetizer. With a chunky pesto, warmed tomatoes and cheese on super crusty bread, it's probably the most well-executed menu item we tried.  There were some down sides, too. The mimosas were constructed en masse in carafes, and weren't cold enough. The Mr ordered a lemoncello that was far too subtle for our taste. It lacked any zing and felt far too heavy for the generous serving size. That was disappointing.   I ordered the Caprese Panino, imagining a crispy edged panini dripping with gooey mozzarella. My stupid American expectations were dashed by a very forgettable sandwich on ciabatta. Cold, sliced mozz. Pesto. Smoked Tomatoes. It was filling but none too impressive. The bread was the biggest component of the sandwich, and I don't think it should have been.  On the side, I made the mistake of ordering the Tuscan Potatoes. The only thing going for these tubers was the flavor. They were HUGE, over-fried and dry. The Mr eventually had to ask for some ketchup to moisten them enough to choke them down. I would have preferred that they were smaller, at the very least.  Service was fine, bathrooms clean, live music on the patio, and apparently the Mr enjoyed his steak and eggs.  Overall, I'd go back, but not for brunch.

This is a fantastic place all around. The ambiance is warm, tables are well spaced, and they have interesting corner booths and seats (where we were) that help facilitate conversations. We started with the steamed pei mussels appetizer, which was delicious. As some others have noted, you'll want to sop up the sauce with bread. My wife also tried two of their specialty drinks, which I can't recall, but were both good. Next we ordered a pappardelle with bolognese to split, and our server brought it on split plates. Also amazing. Finally, my wife and I both ordered the lamb shank over a saffron risotto. Cooked perfectly, and the risotto may have been my favorite part of the meal. I'm a lamb freak/snob - so this was impressive. Apart from the food, our service was outstanding - Meagen was our server.   This was a really great experience that I'd highly recommend to anyone. Easily the best Italian restaurant that I have been to in Charlotte.

I was a little pissed because they were only offering the restaurant week menu, but the waiter (Woody) said we do  À la cart as an option, so we stayed! My boyfriend got the Ligurian Cacciucco with a side of risotto which he loved, and I got a simple pasta with shrimp, and it was very good! The food was great, but the waiter/service was amazing! We appreciate great service, and we will be back!

Wow, what a hidden gem. Came alone on a business trip after a long day of traveling and sat on the patio under cafe lights overlooking a bit of the Charlotte skyline. Awesome music selection, chill vibe, attentive and friendly service (thanks Jim!) And WOW on the food. I had the grillen salmon with brussels, pancetta, and apples with a side of mushrooms.. huge portion of mushrooms, would be good to split the sides. Salmon dish was generous but well portioned as well. Very pleased.

Met up here with some girlfriends for dinner on a Friday night. We sat on the patio and enjoyed the skyline view. I had the Limonada cocktail which was very good. You could barely taste the alcohol. For my main course, I had the salmon. It was VERY good. This was on the list of my waiter's recommendations, and I will definitely get it again.
Nice, fancy, feel like you're in some other city, but more fusion than Italian.  Great Patio, great upstairs bar and view of the city.

We miss VIVACE so much, the Raleigh location is run a bit tighter but the food is fantastic at both locations.  TIPS:   1. Order the Margarita Pizza with a side of crushed red pepper 2. Pair it with a glass of "Gertrude" red blend (Cab, Merlot, Sangiovese) 3. The Hanger Steak with the braised short rib and Yukon potatoes is awesome so order that. 4.  The Pasta's are made in-house and you can taste the difference, have someone else order a pasta dish and steal a bite.

Always spotted this place when i go to the sushi spot near  here in the same shopping center. My friend and i heard they were having a daytime brunch and we decided to go. I love everything about Vivace, from the atmosphere ,from the way its decorated, the vibe, the beautiful people, from food and drinks. Will definitely frequent this place of business the warmer it gets so we can eat outside.I had the calamari and my friend had the meatballs my maraschino Moscow mule was pretty good. Will be back here most definitely.

Classy and hip, modern and classic. Vivace is a the type of establishment you can take your mom to on Thursday then romance that special someone on Friday. The decor is lush and isn't all glamor and glitz. They have amazing service and also great food to back up that pretty little face.   Braised short rib, fried calamari, shrimp capellini - all fabulous. If you want a little more adventurous, eye opening dining experience ask for a seat in the Chef's corner. Not only will you get to see the masters at work, they might even be as generous as to give you free sampling of some tasty treats.   Now that the secrets been out, make sure you make a reservation! This place gets packed and I can assure you, it isn't all hype!
After another lovely evening here, I have to update my stars. Such a good place to get a nice meal!

Atmosphere is nice, appetizers were fair and but the entrees were a complete disappointment!  We were with a party of five and each person commented that their food was very so so.  The menu selection is also very small.  Skip this one.

$30 bottom-less mimosa/bloody Mary brunch - enough said!  $30 brunch (we went on Saturday) gets you unlimited mimosas and/or bloody Marys (you can switch back and forth between them as often as you'd like).  You also get two courses (one each from the left and ride sides of the menu).  I got the mussels (weird for brunch, but I love mussels) and the chicken biscuit (similar to a biscuit and gravy with fried chicken on top).    The mussels were fine - but I've had much better.  The chicken biscuit was on point.  You will get a lot of food.  Our table of four shared a bunch of our items and we couldn't finish out plates.  Now, the 3854 mimosas maybe filled us up, but the food was still all pretty good.  Now, the mimosas.  Let's just say, we uber'ed there and back - and I'm very happy that we did.  Our boozy brunch turned into a 4pm bedtime - and a pretty nice headache.  We will definitely check it out again - likely for brunch.  I'll just pace my mimosas better next time.
OMG THE La Vigili 7 course menus with wine paring was awesome!!  We dined here on Christmas Eve. And we will be coming back

You couldn't ask for a more beautiful location- overlooking the city by a beautiful public park and river (which the city has fine a great job restoring and maintaining). Gorgeous for night and day.  Amazing service, Emmanuel helped us out and was incredibly attentive and thoughtful.   Awesome design, decor and music. This place is sleek but comfortable and completely relaxing.   Great food at reasonable prices- a good place to get Italian deli meats and thin crust pizza. Really enjoyable and delicious.   We just stopped in this place as we were traveling through town, thanks fellow yelpers, and it really made our day. Do the same, you won't regret it :)     - - - -  On the downside, their homemade ricotta is pretty off. It shouldn't be soup. Also the pizza dough is really close but not quite right -  It shouldn't be chip-like at the crust and should have that nice powder on it. Meats need to be cut better, and I think they have a loose understanding of what speck is. Their pecorino was pretty good though.   I have no doubt that these guys will get it right , and very soon. They seem to be working hard to perfect their dishes.

Vivace is a great restaurant with an amazing atmosphere and even better brunch menu. From NC to GA, this is the only restaurant i know of that has there own brunch package. At the price of $30, get your endless mimosas or Bloody Mary's, an appetizer and an entree. Yes, alladat! If not getting the package the mimosas are still $4 for a double which is still a great price. Although the brunch menu has changed a bit from my last visit (where is the French toast?!) it is still filled with a mix of Italian and American favorites. While eating their for New Year's Eve, i ordered the short rib over potatoes with poached eggs. It was hearty, filled with succulent short rib in a nice sauce and the eggs were perfectly poached. Although in my opinion the short rib needed a bit more salt and pepper, leaving it as it was is perfect for the many tastebuds that travel through. Overall, this is a great brunch spot for food and drinks with great friends or strangers because the people of Charlotte are always nice and welcoming! Also Alex the waiter upstairs is amazing and so very thorough!
Great atmosphere and service. The wine menu is good, but prices  could be intimidating. The food is amazing, recommend coming  here  during restaurant week.
